UpnJ_6QsTSf-b1rWs1eUSw.text: Alright, today I decided I am never going back to Flying Biscuit again. I have been a super duper avid fan for the last 5+ years, going regularly, weekly. Even after the horrible incident with the murdered pregnant waitress whose body they dumped at the neighboring Chik-Fil-A-- and suddenly a huge drop in business-- I still made sure they knew I was a loyal customer.  I could write pages about this place. When they hit it, they hit it. Great breakfasts, and sumptuous Southern good, fantastic veg alternatives. Great menu. I wished on a number of occasions in various countries that there existed a Flying Biscuit in everyone of those towns.  Which leads me to present day. Today, I felt a wrench in my gut immediately after eating my burger. But that isn't even the main reason I'm never going back.  There is one waitress there that over the years, I absolutely hate. Hate, hate, hate. Her brain cell count is incredibly low though, it's hard to get mad.  BUT FUCKING TIME SHE MESSES UP OUR ORDER. I think it's like Number Sixth CONSECUTIVE TIME IN A ROW! I think she knows it too, because she always resorts to giving us coffee for free. We started think: is she racist? why does she hate us? we always tip well, but she forces us to want to stiff her. Seriously.  She's not explicitly rude, in fact the opposite, overly fakey southern honey and darling, but with an awkward smidge of forced politeness. And she is incredibly slow. And incredibly terrible as a waitress-- ie. i know she hates her job.  But don't make it my problem every single time I eat there.  Orders always get messed up, or the wrong thing. For example, today. I ordered a burger with a side of green beans. She came back with the burger and a pile of green beans. The burger didn't seem thoroughly cooked, there no jalapeno sauce like on the menu, the green beans were the GODDMAN WORST IVE EVER HAD, so FRICKIN OVERSALTED I HAD TO DRINK 2L of WATER-- and where were my bloody potatoes? Everyone knows potatoes go with a burger.  She ASSUMED I wanted beans instead of potatoes.  SO. I had to wait like 10 mins to get her attention, while my food got cold to tell her.  THEN. She gives me a rude quip, and this "look".  THEN. She comes back suspiciously too fast with these potatoes. They were practically cold, like they'd been sitting there for ages.  It annoys the hell outta me because the potatoes too, were a portion enough to feed an entire African country. I am not going to just EAT a mountain of cold potatoes.  My stomach is gurgling now. I hate Charlotte food. Charlotte food sucks.

1pC3wP-mBvO1oXh4WlminA.text: Very disappointing. On the plus side, greeting and service was very friendly. Decor was cool.  We visited on 9/19/12 around 11:30 am. The food was a huge disappointment. Two eggs, chicken sausage, potatoes and biscuit $7.99. Chicken sausage was hard, dry, and maybe made the day before?. Terrible!  The potatoes also could not have beent fresh, reheated, and tasteless. I'm not sure what the moon dust was they advertised, as they were plain. The signature biscuit was large and hard, cold and dusted with sugar. Poor value and bad food, not a good mix, sorry but I'm being honest.  p.s. I originally wrote this after our visit on 9/19/12, but not sure why it was sitting waiting to post. So here it is, hopefully, gotten better.

t3f9jRNpTMlGMuOyvvWv8w.text: Wow! Best breakfast by far!! The place is cute and cozy and has outdoor seating. Greeted and seated immediately by a very pleasant and attentive server. Coffee was ok, but then again I'm so picky about coffee, but dont go by me. I had the Southern Benedict and it was Incredible. Open faced homemade biscuit topped with pimiento cheese, poached egg, choice of turkey or pork bacon. My fat ass chose pork and it was topped with two perfectly poached egg and just enough hollandaise sauce. My grits didn't need any butter or salt. Perfection. My boyfriend has chicken biscuits and gravy. I was skeptical about the chicken part, but it was delicious. Definitely didn't miss the pork and serving was huge!! I'm goin back soon!!! On a side note; The owner or manager came over to our table because we were looking for suggestions on where to go for fried chicken, told us to go to Price Chicken Coop. I'm loving this place!!! Yeah baby!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits, eggs, and chicken sausage gravy. Fabulous!!
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern Benedict-omg!

p_heXzy8CRJCe5kEwdoTeQ.text: Let's start with these were the best grits I have ever tasted. I am not w huge grits count consumer, but I. A word:  Outstanding. Flavorful with a creamy texture. Off the charts. They make their own chicken sausage. I was a little skeptical, but it was excellent. And the biscuits...while they weren't flying, they were huge and flavorful. Try adding their homemade apple butter on the biscuit and you will not be disappointed.

qiaoRHkf3-oAzCFEnDPfIg.text: Haven't been to the flying biscuit in years. It was 8:30 on Saturday night, decided to go in and enjoy some good food. Me and my partner got turned away at the door saying the kitchen just closed. Thought everyone should know that.

n5pqEAAgWEZhU848T0PQnw.text: This place is very different. Good service and good food. Come here if you're tired of the same old breakfast.

Cjr8S5BDCLBUYm48WpO3iw.text: We landed on a night when it wasn't very busy. The wait staff was a little slow but the food was amazing. Oh! The shrimp and grits. When in doubt, get grits.

rl9fcOdURcsSP_G42mNRcA.text: For some reason this place is just around the corner and we've only been there twice. Once for dinner a few years back and just recently for lunch. For the dinner visit we actually had breakfast items; all were good and equal to average diner foods.  Our lunch last Saturday was just OK. The Fried Green Tomatoes had no seasoning to the crust and the goat cheese overpowered the slight sourness of the tomato.  My salad had old black greens mixed into the mix and the chicken was the cheap chopped and formed variety and not fresh.  And our waiter seemed to disappear towards the end making us have to ask for him and get our check. And the biscuits are bland and dry. Guess we won't head back.

Ubsmrpc7iOfL0zjwewEZ9A.text: Flying Biscuit is the place that introduced me to grits so I am eternally thankful for that. Their grits are so amazingly yummy that I don't want to go anywhere else for grits because it could come with disappointment. But then again, I'm not from the South so I'm not sure if  thats how all grits are or even if all grits are created equally? Anyways, enough of my thoughts about grits. They have chicken sausage, egg whites,turkey bacon which is a nice alternative to the regular stuff and serve breakfast all day. I've had both breakfast and lunch and found their lunch to be quite mundane so if you go, stick with breakfast, I love all the funky colors they have incorporated into the decor and their apple butter is tasty. If you go, be prepared to wait since there is usually a wait to get a table unless you want to sit at the counter.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

UWKQGhjTkjmsHrSHetb7Lg.text: I was disappointed. Your biscuits should be delicious if you are going to have it in your name. They were hard, overworked and cold. The apple butter was tasty but nothing else. Staff was nice though

cDgroSJV_f49t_iJWGcC5g.text: Very unique food pairings that you can't find just anywhere but are done very well. Two must tries are the love cakes (black bean) and the biscuits with apple butter. If you're looking for something different this is your place.

OOQmCPQzdnDQb6pvYXmngg.text: Awesome breakfast and great staff. Breakfast all day on the menu. Eggs Benedict was awesome, but the pimento cheese was a little much. If you order, ask them to go easy on the PC. Certainly nice to find a restaurant like this in the middle of a strip mall area like this.

eBoy4LWCgsB9tMKDxrXayA.text: Hands down best biscuits and grits in the world! It's a great place for a quick breakfast and the staff is on top of everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

QxjHAZhR4BjPgFn-ODxxJA.text: I was already late for work on a snowy day and so I decided to give this place a try thinking it'd take a bit to cook my togo order. But it wasn't long at all! My food was done super quick! It was maybe a five minute wait! I ordered the Piedmont Omelet with Egg Whites, & Add Spinach, and Pancakes. The grits were the best i've ever had at a restaurant. Sooooo creamy!! If you like thicker grits, you may not like these though. You can tell they put sour cream in them. I can taste it. But I loved them! The biscuit was really hard. I just trashed it. They gave me what tasted like Apples, I thought it was Jelly. But after reading reviews I think it was supposed to be a butter. They also didn't include any butter for my pancake. I would have liked a little more egg and less meat in my omelet. I like egg in my omelet. Was too much meat in my opinion. Plus the place is kind of expensive for breakfast if you ask me. $18 total for my meal. It was still pretty good though.  Will be returning. It was at least better than ihop.

jnTAD9fYmye1pAidcWtLmg.text: Southern scramble was very tasty! I'll be doing this at home now. Grits were buttery. Great service!

3byLEr8KsaqM5ryZhpAyMg.text: Walked in to a very colorful breakfast establishment with friendly employees. The service was quick and the food was delicious and I left out satisfied. Their name holds True to their biscuits which are delicious! I will be back next visit to Charlotte.

qfxYJ4kPF5pVdPYKLcFYUA.text: Cute breakfast place in the midst of a lot of shopping.  The portions are generous for sure.  But the food wasn't impressive.  I ordered the eggstravaganza which come with a little bit of everything but almost everything arrived room temperature :-/.  The grits were too creamy and soupy for my taste.  The French toast was tasty and came with a delicious jam. The service was fast and friendly but I was highly disappointed in the biscuit.  Considering the name is flying biscuit I had pretty high expectations... Oh well.  I may be back but will probably order just French toast

Eb-SObt5ybvv-WmBDhQueg.text: The food was really good and the staff was really nice. The only thing that bothered me was the way the manager or owner not sure which, spoke to his staff. I understand that restaurant jobs are stressful but be professional when your in front of customers.

BsVI1KcTiG1hLMnMtOjXrg.text: Delicious fresh food, courteous service and great coffee.....will definitely go again

y-oGtHhlHq1TbyCJBYGQOw.text: Finally made it Flying Biscuit for breakfast and here's the skinny on the not-so-skinny.  Loved the potatoes. LOVED.  The biscuits really are very good....and very big! These things are the size of your fist and can easily fill you up.   The apple butter. Oooooh, the apple butter. I asked the waiter to put a little extra in my to-go baggie b/c I wanted to do kinky things with it. Yeah, I said it. He cracked up then gave me an actual soup container FULL of this sweet heaven. Bless you, Juan, bless you.   Juan was an awesome waiter. Attentive, funny, on the spot, obliging and did not rush us even though the place was slammed.  I really liked my light and flavorful chicken wrap and my husband really appreciated the size & quality of his pasta/eggs/veggie combo.  I'd say this place earned a solid 3.75 STARS and here's why: a) it takes A LOT to get five stars from me b) we were quoted a 15-20 minute wait. We froze our tooties off in the wind and drizzle for damn near one hour. I've been a hostess. I've been a server. There are ways to correctly estimate wait times. This was so not cool. c) the tables are tooooo close.  Overall though, we were quite pleased and, luckily, we don't live closer - otherwise we'd be here more often and I'd be in a diabetic coma from that apple butter.

ykJjJC6XcuTEbWA0qDvr3A.text: Great place for breakfast! I had the Garden Fresh Veggie Scramble with fresh fruit which also came with their signature biscuit. The scramble was delicious and I liked that the veggies were hearty. The fruit was your typical mix of melon, grapes and pineapple. The biscuit was huge and so tasty! There are a lot of choices to choose from though some of it seemed a bit pricey. The staff was attentive and the food came quickly. Went during the week after regular breakfast hours so wasn't that busy. Interior was small and quirky!

y2Ey1TugLOU0C8EYd6rQnA.text: Flying B - I love you... but I need you to upgrade your lettuce standards.  Your Fried BLT Salad is quite literally my favorite salad in the Queen City, but the past THREE times I've ordered it there has been wilted lettuce in my salad.  One time I even sent it back and when it came back out the lettuce was STILL wilted.  Please please please try harder!  It's your only flaw!

0_hhDwSD8jlSxma0l0DH0A.text: Sad to say; I was looking forward to trying this place. But we had called ahead for our party of 15 and we're told that it would take about a half hour to get the table ready. We get there, the hostess had an attitude (we wanted to know the ETA because we had a movie to get to at Stonecrest) and we were told that they can't hold tables; we wait half an hour and large parties that got there after us (a 7-person party comes to mind) are being seated before us. Why not just tell us that you can't hold tables over the phone? Consistency of policy is key.

ZDXdmlM0t5JZoJsBFqzsdw.text: Again came here as a group of 7.  No wait at all (got lucky).  Smoked Salmon Scramble (ended up ordering another one since the boys liked my dish).  Daughter enjoyed the Biscuit Chicken Pot Pie. Can't remember what the others ordered.  All I know is that we all enjoyed it.  Mom did enjoy the grits.  :-)  Will return if in the area!

jwxCUxvf_pjH_4d7vP0ErA.text: Awesome food and great service. Try the biscuits and gravy. It's chicken gravy and it is incredible

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

zg25UyKveXreZdN1GaS-sQ.text: Our Parents of Allergic Kids members were discussing breakfast options. One of our members said: "We have had good luck at stonecrest flying biscuit. One of the servers has a pn allergy and was very knowledgeable."  Thank you for taking care of the food allergic community, it is appreciated.

KJ-G1OqLAjHVAJfJG6EU3A.text: The waitress was horrible and in a mood, she needed to check her attitude at the door! The biscuits were large and looked good But they were extremely dry! Ordered 2 kids grilled Mac and cheese and sent them back my kids wouldn't eat it, greasy greasy greasy!! Then we got a kids French toast  It was a few pieces of soggy bread sticks. Everything on the menu sounds good My eggs Benedict was good, my mothers pancakes were ok she said But I don't know if I would go back to give it a second try.

T-WXn8vNwQ51sV4bM3Pblw.text: Love it here and the staff is (almost) always friendly. Turkey and eggs for breakfast

8NZz6Lbx6J2yneywIZQCoA.text: Starting off poorly. Waited 30 minutes for a table to watch them seat a 7 top before us. Host said they called our name but we can see and hear the hostess station.

nfSwNs6gyp9TdwmGgh6a1A.text: So I love anywhere you can order breakfast outside of morning hours. And any place that gets creative with their breakfast options gets high marks in my book.   I respect that they try to keep it fresh and on the healthy-side. You'll find organic options and turkey instead of pork.  Some of my favorites are the Turkey Hash (which comes topped with fried eggs) and the Southern Style Biscuit Benedict.    I'm also a fan of the Fried Egg Sandwich.    My only complaint, is that for restaurant with Biscuit in the name..the biscuits aren't really that good. They are dense and dry...but the Flying Biscuit makes up for that by serving you home-made apple butter that is out of this world.  Really, I could drink the stuff.  The apple butter goes GREAT on pancakes.

btWE2_ZNTozSH7d0AXUwOg.text: Very good biscuits , very good breakfast, the service is usually good, I've been there more than 10 times.

pYCWeY0wpBY5MyN81Sa1dQ.text: Best place for Breakfast (served anytime) Brunch or Lunch. Great omelettes, pancakes, especially the organic oatmeal, salads, and sandwiches. Super biscuit(along with home made apple butter). For a change, I'll order fish tacos with their baked mac and cheese. Even better than the food is the fast, friendly service. All of the staff is great. Two who stand out are Greg and Olivia. Expect a wait on Saturday and Sunday mornings, but enjoy an outdoor table during the warmer weather.

6guuxKOZDeyH4Hq2tX-W2g.text: Came here to eat with my friends. I have to say the southern style eggs benedict was great and our server Amanda M. was the best.

1fuvnw1WqHhqJ_jLnm4r1w.text: My first southern breakfast dining experience and it was...overwhelming. In a good way, of course. I'd rather have too much food than too little, especially when I'm starting off my day. The egg-ceptional eggs are, well, exceptional. Their biscuits are awesome and the serving size is perfect for Sunday brunch. Most important they have mimosas, a great way to start your day. I wasn't a fan of their sausage which knocks a star off. Kinda harsh yes but I'm super picky about sausage and ever in search of the best breakfast sides. Plus, yelp won't let you rate places half a star (can we review yelp?). Anyway, I'll order bacon for sure next time but everything else was great.

RZ8T2VkCrR1WspfAxMO4Gg.text: I loooove the classic Flying Biscuit Breakfast! Chicken sausage is no guilt but creamy dreamy grits give the guilt right back! Yum! Orange Scented French Toast, oh em gee...raspberry sauce and honey creame anglaise. This is a dessert for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. PERFECT! The Flying Biscuit Breakfast. 2 eggs, 2 chicken sausage, dreamy grits, &amp; a biscuit.

OrZzCO54lcudyGAMn8koCg.text: I ordered the turkey meatloaf, mashed potatoes, and mac and cheese. By far the worst food EVER.  The mac and cheese look like hash browns and taste like slop. The meat loaf had hard cheese on the top.  No sauce. Very dry. The potatoes were ok. The biscuit was nothing special. You would think it was the highlight but it was a big tasteless piece of dry bread.  Please find another cook and revamp the menu.  Awful. If I could give you a 0 I would.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Disgusting. Worst meal ever. Fire the cook please. Turkey meatloaf, mac and cheese, mashed potatoes. Def not soul food.

DwkODb4i4uCfTyiyTz01HA.text: The last 2 times I've been to Charlotte I've eaten here for breakfast! (I live in Dallas)  This place is typically pretty crowded so be prepared for a little wait.  It's so worth it though.

NW3v50XLeqAdxmBHcNAsiQ.text: My only question is WHY haven't we eaten here before NOW?? We are new to Charlotte, NC (been here since Nov.2012) and frequent Blakney shops, Stonecrest and Ballantyne shops as we were in corporate housing in Ballantyne until recently when our home was finished. We drove past and saw this place on many occassions and never thought to go in and have breakfast.   After a great couples massage, the hubby and I were hungry and were driving and we thought maybe we should check out the menu at that Flying Biscuit place it does have buscuit in it's name so breakfast should be on the menu.  We arrived and were immediately seated in the country looking, quaint restaurant. I immediately noticed the decor which was fun and attention grasping which is great for conversation and great to keep children interested which I noticed was going on a couple of tables over from us.   My husband ordered the Chicken Sausage & Turkey Bacon Egg white omlette with a homemade biscuit & grits and I ordered the infamous Shrimp & Grits. Now I'm from Chicago and Wishbone in Chicago HANDS DOWN has the BEST Shrimp and Grits so I was very skeptical.  My husband ENJOYED his meal and is sooo excited about going back. ME on the other hand had HIGHER expectations for the Shrimp Grits from the reviews. They don't have ANYTHING on the Shrimp grits in Chicago at Wishbone. However the day after when I heated up my left overs the flavors had time to mix and mingle and it tasted much better (still not Wishbone in Chicago or 131 Main in Blakney).  I will be back to try something else as my husband is definitely impressed with the food for the price ;-)

-qkIsXYobP81H1BPfsJUwQ.text: The feeling in there is very casual and the service is great. The food is good, I love their eggs. My only complaint with the food would be that the potatoes aren't very crispy and the biscuits can be a little dry. Other than that, it is a great breakfast/lunch restaurant with fresh food and great vegetarian options. The food is affordable and high quality. I have been there many time and will be returning.

oG33CRPcSgoBRTDIJyen7A.text: Comfort breakfast food with unique biscuits. Everything was good, but service was achingly slow. We had to ask three times for coffee, then again for cream. Meal took quite some time to be prepared, and the waitress was not keeping an eye on our drinks. Nothing special.

LwjF7Vd7idF04xCY9YIlEg.text: Food: Minus 1 Star.  With the exception of the pancakes, the food that this restaurant offers is not good.   Cost: Minus 1 Star.  The lack in quality of the food does not deserve the price this place charges. I think I'd rather go to Ihop. Customer Service: Minus 2 Stars.  The people in this restaurant are not exactly the smartest people.  Nor are they the fastest in getting us the food either.  Overall, this place is not worth the wait if you have to stand in line. Just go to ihop.

XfbISQJ64cVrw4XBbNT4qg.text: The biscuit was great. The grits were great. The apple butter is amazing. A great breakfast spot.

DJ7xqxkPaYn5zDF19EYxqg.text: Funny, the same stuff gets executed much better here than in Atlanta's NW location, which I reviewed a few weeks ago.  Service was fine here too.

N4w6RomUlUz4vVJrcqPvMQ.text: Went for lunch last Friday - I loved it. I've been looking for places for lunch - being a single guy and all and the food, service, selection - was all great.

WVS4t2bnDQck41X1gQoCGQ.text: This place is awesome. Everything I've had there is delicious and today's vegan burritos were no exception. There are meat items too but a ton for vegetarians and vegans

nkARWRRybnq5IQX6N7Dw0Q.text: I've been to this restaurant twice and enjoyed both times. Much better the first time when I went the first time and ate a hummus wrap with tomato soup. Amazing lunch, great service, nothing to complain about unless you're a health freak!

plAEEiPh9Yf_r_9yfmccOw.text: Great food. Tough place to take small kids. Very crowded and loud and they don't know how to set the air conditioning to over 50 degrees. Having said all that, I still go with my wife and little girls a couple times a month for breakfast. The food rocks!

qD8uJD2XpVgWX5fD3HI0hA.text: smoked salmon breakfast is on point. grits are on point so good no cheese needed. no red meat served here for real deal carnivores but its not missed in this trendy spot. As you may assume the biscuits are good. Mainly a breakfast spot. customer service was good like mother in law good but not bad enough to complain.my only issue is that there is no Crystals hot sauce when will the world understand. hot sauce is like liquid gold for many dishes.

sVVXOsLYYWgVwMKMskwDqg.text: Let me clear the air about The Flying Biscuit: it's not good. I ordered the steak and eggs, and the steak was advertised on the menu as being medium rare. I've never had such an overcooked steak in my life. It was tough and mealy. My eggs were perfect, but my eggs are also perfect at the Waffle House in Clemson at 4am. My dining partner got the Coca-Cola glazed salmon, but the glaze was neither Coca-Cola nor glaze. I would give the FB one star, but the baked brie saved the day.

GU7tsoErb3IdbhKOs_2BDw.text: Odd thing about this place - the biscuits suck.  They are a weird combination of sweet and very "heavy" tasting. The grits are really good though.  Menu items are hit or miss.  A lot better than le peep.

Dc1Deo7Jgf_hdYpRSl9P_w.text: What a treat!!!  My friend and I were working at her home transitioning her project over to me.  We decided to take a lunch and she offered up the Flying Biscuit Cafe.  When we walked in, the place was packed.  We were the last table to be seated without having to wait (this was at 11:45 a.m. on a Wednesday).  The menu was very diverse - a ton of vegetarian options, but of course I went the carnivorous route!  I had their oven fried chicken.  It came with GRILLED MACARONI!!!  I had never had grilled macaroni and fell in love as soon as I tasted it - it is like your grandmother's macaroni recipe she served you on special occasions like Thanksgiving!  Instead of collard greens, I substituted with grits.  These are the creamiest, silkiest grits I have ever had!  I LOVE apple butter, but The Flying Biscuit kicks it up a notch by adding cranberries.  This is to die for...  Thank you Flying Biscuit for a wonderful culinary experience!

du3NVcYB9G_S-ibTO8JLGA.text: Flying Biscuit has consistently dropped in service.  I have been going there since it opened but will not be returning to waste my money. Last time, I had breakfast, the coffee was weak, the scrambled eggs were runny and the biscuit was not even fully cooked and mushy in the middle. My idea of fruit is not just honey dew with melons and two pieces of pineapple chunks. I rather go to Terrace Cafe up the street where they have the original red velvet waffles and the fruit plate actually has a variety of fresh fruit.

gQ0bixjKCc-ezczBEQvajw.text: A favorite breakfast/lunch spot in Charlotte. It's similar to Zada Jane's in that is has lots of options for vegetarians and lots of organic options. The decoration is cozy and colorful, diner-esque, if you will.  True to the name, the biscuits are awesome. Be prepared for a long wait.

Fu82vniv3J75FAKsfF66DQ.text: I love breakfast so I've been dying to try The Flying Biscuit and I was not disappointed at all.  The organic oatmeal pancakes with peach compote are heavenly!  I'm not big on super sweet stuff at breakfast and these were perfect....just sweet enough, but not so sugary that you can't make it through the whole plate.  My bf and I also shared an order of the fried green tomatoes for a starter.  They are topped with cashew-jalepeno relish that is the ideal combination of subtle spice and rich, creamy nutiness.  Lightly fried and not heavy or greasy at all.  The biscuits....honestly, I have had better.  But, the apple butter that goes on them is awesome!  Slightly tart but still sweet and yummy yummy.  I topped all of that off with a gigantic chai latte that you can get either hot or iced....I opted for hot and it was delicious.  I had already ordered it before I realized there is also booze on the menu.....bloody marys and mimosas for those who want their afternoon brunch with a little kick.  All in all, superb food that came out super fast with slightly slow service due to the amount of business.  I can't wait to go back and try out some other menu items!  Oh and one more note, if you don't like rosemary, don't get the potatoes.  My bf hates it but ordered them without knowing and the herb was too potent for him to even make it through more than one bite.

_398v8GXRyJav5QcGNkJWQ.text: Came here with two other couples. We came for a saturday brunch and they were busy as always but we didn't have to wait long at all.   Juan was a server and he was just plain awesome! He made me laugh and cheered me up. I'm not really a morning person but he had me cracking up the whole time. He gave excellent service. I got an omelette and it was delicious. I've never had their moon potatoes before but they were good and crispy!

Grbfz0eb_4X3TCKEMA9-Rg.text: Pretty cool restaurant. I've been here a few times and enjoyed my meals but today was amazing. I had the Turkey Hash. I was blown away by the tenderness and flavor of the turkey. I now have my Go-To meal here. Their grits are equally awesome. Very cool wait staff as well. Enjoy your meal here.

WbH5JhzNNqKFT-5tHNZvxQ.text: My duaghter went today asked for a simple omlet no cheese as she cant eat lactose. Cook put in cheese and now she is sick. Concerns me that a place cant make a simple meal and dollow food allergy instructions. We wont be back to this location

V2U6WFpMHTu4Awug6lMY1w.text: Great food and service! I had the veggy scramble and it was delicious. They also have really good grits here. Olivia was our server and she took great care of us. We'll be coming back.

784X1E4Vo6a4zOCN-sukRg.text: Shout out to the kitchen at The Flying Biscuit!  The food is always well presented and consistently tasty. Up until recently the service was really good as well, but my last two visits have found me with surly, unattentive servers which certainly dampens my desire to return even though the food is unique and flavorful. Hopefully, they can get things sorted out.

AVmtBNTwvXm1t73mKbo7Rw.text: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day, or at least that's what "they" say. Whoever "they" are, they are right. With a good meal in my belly, I was ready to take on the world! Or at least, I was ready to show my daughter how to take on some paper targets at the range in Matthews.  I've never seen any of their biscuits actually "fly", but they are excellent. Light and fluffy, I don't know why anyone would swap out toast instead. Mmm... big squeezy bottle of apple butter to top it with. Fab.  Other than the biscuits, I had two poached eggs (cooked perfectly) and two chicken sausages that were spicy and delicious. The small bowl of grits were nice and firm but not crunchy. Delish!  Service was pretty decent and the place was very crowded on a Saturday morning. It was raining, so we weren't able to sit outside.  Okay, world. Let's go!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Poached eggs, biscuits, grits and sausages!
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Piedmont omelet

nBR7VGWI_lb6cXFQNVv_IQ.text: My coworker and I had no clue what we wanted for lunch so we stumbled into The Flying Biscuit and were pleasantly surprised and very pleased with our visit!   We were greeted immediately and were told to chose our own seating, we picked a table in the back by the window. I totally fell in love with the quaint surrounding, they had country table linens,bright colored walls and a beautifully painted ceiling with pictures and quotes...make sure when you visit to look up! It was a very nice touch!   Once seated we reviewed the menu and they have a really nice selection no matter what you have a taste for! They serve breakfast all day which includes everything from omelets to breakfast sandwiches...and of course biscuits! For lunch and dinner you also have a great selection of salads, sandwiches and other home cooked meals like shrimp and grits and turkey pot roast.  I decided to try the 3B Chicken sandwich. It had blue cheese, turkey bacon, basil and tamari aioli on a grilled chicken breast. As a side I chose the oven roasted "moon dusted" rosemary potatoes.   The wait for our food was quick...we were one if only four tables in the whole place. And our waitress was a real sweetheart, glasses alway full and she was very attentive!   When the food arrived, it looked delicious! Huge portions, which is always a win in my book! And everything tasted great! I loved the combination of the aioli and blue cheese with the crisp turkey bacon! The chicken was very well seasoned and tender. The rosemary potatoes were very good...not overwhelming with flavor but a very nice addition to the meal!   The best part was that everything came out HOT! And I love that they give you so many alternatives here like turkey bacon, veggie patties and tofu.   Overall, great experience, service and food! Definitely will be back! Hopefully, next time to try their breakfast and one of those famous biscuits!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3B Chicken Sandwich

DYVUWXgj5qANilbBQQhhiQ.text: The fried green tomatoes came out cold and honestly are not edible. That sweet cashew topping they put on it to me is just gross with the tomatoes. Side of potatoes was average. Egg tortilla was fine but how do you screw that up? I did taste the biscuit and it is good but it's a bisquit.  So what? Oh and they serve that delicious diner royal cup coffee. Yuck. $20 and there is nothing about that meal that I would come back for. Honestly people you can do better than that at home.  The only reason I came in this morning is because there was a water main break and I'm without water.  If I'm going to go out for breakfast it must be something a step up from what I would do myself and that would be Another Broken Egg

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Their version of fried green tomatoes with some sweet cashew topping and sour cream?! Yuck

LdJr0Zy01Gt7xydNmjtPJg.text: I loveeeee this place for when I'm craving breakfast! The French toast is amazing and what tops the food off is the great service, especially when I'm in Amanda's section! She's so good at getting you anything you want and not making you wait -- all while staying super friendly! I recommend her section for sure!

Ut5m1rfhUCHz4L-Qs7ozWA.text: Love the biscuits and grits! Everything else could use a little more oomph, however their service is great! Had a mommy and baby outing with over 12 people and they sat us near the front with quick service! We weren't rushed but were given everything so promptly that we were in and out within an hour!

gwyyMuwaavuqp2Tr2qUQfA.text: The theme is attractive. I like the outdoor seating, but if it costs you good service to be seated outside, I rather opt for the indoor seating. It took forever for our order to be taken and our food to arrive, and it wasn't too busy.   I ordered the baked green tomatoes to start, and I enjoyed them. The peanut garnish was tasty, but I do wish the tomatoes would've been crispier. I also ordered the bbq salmon plate and substituted the green beans for collard greens. I was excited for my choice, but the salmon was horrible. It didn't taste like it was cleaned well nor was it marinated long enough to have the ingredients settle. I ended up sending it back. The piece of the biscuit that I tried, was crispy yet soft, and I see why that's their main attraction. The greens were good, but the mashed potatoes were probably the tastiest thing on my plate. Either way, I couldn't eat any of it after I had a taste of the salmon. Totally turned off.

4NE3MZIQGM95mIy4v9Q5Qw.text: I come to the area several times a year and the Flying Biscuit has become my only breakfast place when I am in town. The service has been consistently outstanding and the food is excellent.  I am literally fascinated by how fast my food arrives once I order. A particular favorite is the High Flyer Breakfast. I was a bit skeptical when I read organic oatmeal pancakes with peach compote and chicken sausage, but it was and continues to be delicious.   My favorite time is in the spring and fall when can sit out under the shade trees on their pet friendly patio.

rrhVTaZs0InkJdwgcLE9_w.text: This is a nice restaurant serving really good and healthy food. If we are rating the food the gravy and biscuits were some of the most delicious I've ever had. However, the service takes away from the delicious food. It took them about 30 minutes to bring us our drinks after we were seated. We didn't order anything complicated, just 4 waters. After we were brought our drinks, we ordered and it took them another 30 minutes to bring us our food. It seemed like no one was getting good service. The people behind us had kids and they were waiting so long the kids were crying.  Overall great food, but horrible service.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit eggs and gravy
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

5qpeCpLCYF5QY7xtrP_Wlg.text: Unique style of food. Loved that the Mac and cheese came out in the shape of bars. You get a lot of food for how much you pay for. The food is not as flavorful as I would have hoped and the biscuit is a little too doughy

Fbhy4ebkbl8iscf5SjJwVg.text: I love love love flying biscuit! I've been busy and out of town a lot, but my boyfriend and I eat breakfast here every Sunday when we are free. The service is always excellent no Matter how busy they are. They always make sure that your coffee is filled and your water is too! My favorite is usually to try the specials they have, which are typically crepes, French toast or some kind of pancakes. My boyfriend always gets the Clifton omelette. When I don't get the special, I get a short stack of blueberry pancakes with the raspberry sauce and honey angelaise sauce to spread on top. It tastes like heaven! I always add a side of their crispy pork bacon and get a biscuit. The biscuits are perfectly flakey, warm and sprinkled with sugar on top. Add some butter and you will have yourself a delicious biscuit. Highly recommend for the food and service. Just try to get there early because they usually have a wait. They do have a bar you can sometimes find seating at.

GgxlWhKuljvcNtgyr7Rm2w.text: The best place for breakfast hands down. They have the best service and the best customer service. Specially with uber eats! Never had a problem with them getting my order wrong! Nutritious food and filling. Biscuits are the best!!!! Love this place and highly recommend!!!

esEjWQaXtgrnjLVrdATHkw.text: I enjoy this place and I love the location better than the Southpark location. They have a great outside patio for warm sunny days.   The staff is super Friendly and attentive. The food is always great. Their creamy dreamy grits are well named. Their signature biscuits are fantastic, especially with the apple butter.   I always enjoy bringing my out of town guests here for a fun twist to a southern breakfast/brunch!

L3CBuJUt6HPp-ym_wp8Oyg.text: Food is always delicious and the service is pretty good for the most part. Have had some slow ones in the past but over all perfect. Love the Turkey Hash with Goat Cheese grits fantastic. I DO NOT like cranberries but their CranApple Butter is great on a chuck of sod. Food has arrived so...

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits and apple-cranbutter, Mmm

1eSMHS49IDWkG-eWSKvsfQ.text: I got the Clifton Omelette and it was okay, but a bit bland. The potatoes were decent and well seasoned. Their coffee was average, but some of the cups were old.   The main aspect that really ruined our experience was our waitress, Adriana.  One of our party was about 15 minutes late due to unforeseen traffic problems and the waitress seemed extremely agitated by this. She was rude and rushed us the whole meal. About 45 minutes into our party's time at the table, she threw the check on out table and 5 minutes later came back to began trying to clear our plates while we were still eating. She went so far as to try to take a fork out of one of our friends' hand. The friend said that they were still trying to eat, so the waitress proceeded to make comments to the bus boy about us dragging our feet.  She also did not bring the change back to my friend who paid a $12 check with a $20 bill.

9Pjbqv9drONRYXHdlgRUEw.text: Very basic service, had to ask for water, and a coffee refill. Bacon and biscuit was warmed up not fresh. Egg was cooked perfectly. Gravy looked like congealed pudding. Server was cold, indifferent, and never asked how meal was.

q1tF_SJX-m36nSnu15M5Hg.text: We always go for dinner and never have to wait.  I always have the biscuit and gravy with scrambled eggs.  I'm boring, but it's always good.  Love the biscuit with jam.  My 8YO doesn't like their twist on breakfast, making it more healthy.  My 16YO loves it and always gets something different.   I must be the only one that doesn't like their twist on grits and I normally LOVE grits.  I think they use a smoked cheese that I don't like, but everyone else seems to love them.  I opt for the fruit, always fresh and tasty.

x-RitwusUYaiN9lmeQUWdw.text: This place is quite good! I haven't ate many times there, but when I do it's typically brunch. The coffee is delicious and...   Best Tip About This Place: Guinness with Espresso Shots!! BEST THING ON THE MENU!!  A small drawback to the breakfast menu: no oatmeal, no english muffins.

lhkQxW4bbfj1s03GGIccQA.text: We love to go to the StoneCrest location for breakfast. We ask for Susan P every time we go.  She makes you feel at home, great sense of humor..along with great service. The food is always spectacular! We love their biscuits, Turkey hash, Pimento sauce, turkey sausage, sausage gravy, Peach compote & famous enough apple butter, just to name a few. We refer a bunch of our friends, why should we be the only ones to know about this fun breakfast place.   Thanks for making us feel like family !!

HdCiqiOHWlkqiE7Da49nvQ.text: Looks like my review will go against the grain.    I visited the flying biscuit about 8 AM on a Saturday.  The restaurant was almost half full.  I was greeted promptly.  Greetings etc. was fine.  Coffee was ok.  I got the high flyer.  I asked for eggs over medium.  They arrived less than over easy.  I did not eat them.  The whites were not even set.  Grits were ok.  A little too much cream in them.  Chicken sausage was too salty.  Oatmeal pancake was good.  Biscuit was dry.  Overall I can't recommend this place.  Maybe it was just my server and my cook.  I don't know.  I would have complained about the eggs, but my server never asked how my food was.  Servers were eating in my sight and there were two drinks on the counter belonging to the servers.  Both of these things were health violations,  With so many options in the south charlotte area, it will be some time before I return.  If at all.  Not a fan.  I don't know when restaurants in the area will stop resting on their laurels and counting on return customers.  All I wanted,this morning was friendly service and a tasty simple breakfast.  Denied.

dsBB8OJvbvDQxQ9VNYmC1A.text: Great prices for a kids meal!   Their biscuits are dense so a meal in of itself.   Will go back.   As far as this location the server was incredibly sweet and danced with my kids and since the lunch service was over gave us a box of biscuits.

L5FbIFoBnT5cgtLLx1N_xA.text: I've been coming to this restaurant for years and I can honestly say it's one of my favorites! The service has always been quick, polite, and helpful, and the food is delicious. I get grits and moon-dusted potatoes with whatever I order - they're my favorite! The biscuits are also truly one of a kind - served with a bit of sugar on top and with a side of DELICIOUS apple butter. I'm addicted!

F6ceFioDN-lnUXX9qzeIsA.text: I stopped in for dinner last night, craving their grits... the only thing that was any good during this visit were the fried eggs.  I ordered the High Flyer again, my usual order at both locations, and it was a wreck.    Service was friendly and attentive, as usual.  On a Friday night, there were two other tables seated, and they were finishing up when I sat down.  Both Biscuits refuse to fully air condition the restaurant, so it was as tropical as the table cloths.    The food: The eggs, cooked to over-well, were perfect.   The chicken sausage was over cooked and almost crunchy.  So overly seasoned that I woke up at 1 am and it felt like my chest was on fire from indigestion. The biscuit - well, I stated before how I feel about their biscuits.  Too heavy and really just a way to get the delicious apple cranberry butter into my pie hole. But at least it wasn't burned. I substituted a buttermilk pancake for the oatmeal pancake and it was burned AGAIN.  It's a pancake - if you burn it, throw it out and give me another one - it's not a steak, it's batter that probably costs less than a nickel.   The grits - my favorite grits - grits that make my mouth water every time I drive by this or the Park Rd location - were AWFUL.  Overly cheesed and overly salty, clumps of grits were stuck together - BAD.    As my Pawpaw said, during his final days, after spending the weekend with a family member that will make you wish death would come soon, "I ain't goin' back".

oanZQmb3QAKbQAhvNBidVw.text: This place never disappoints! I have only ever been here for breakfast, but every plate I've ever had is simply amazing. I say simply because they don't "over do it" like some places. The food is good food prepared to be just that, it's not decoration it's well flavored, well prepared food!

1Kn1RQ0TdIdhbTp2ZB3KJQ.text: Don't believe the hype. Way too pricey for what it is... Felt like breakfast at Moe's. Not one biscuit flew!

PUY_DSXHr9Z9VbB6gLZMlg.text: Not your typical breakfast spot... Which isn't a bad thing at all. I'd recommend this to anyone who is a vegetarian for breakfast or lunch. Their pancakes and grits are totally worth the wait.

Npdm8s5zjeNICMEo8XYX4A.text: It's 2:52 on a Sunday, Yelp says this business closes at 4:00. Me and my fiance go in for a late brunch. The blonde at the front immediately says "we close at 3 but you can still be seated" how rude, don't lie to customers because your ready to go home. If you don't want to work on Sunday find another job. We will never come back.

gyOKp1U9IN9VfTMtDJbDUw.text: Not impressed with the breakfast, I've been to all locations in Charlotte and I much prefer the dinner options. The grits are the only thing that are alright, the meat that's not really meat that passes for turkey or real bacon is pathetic.  The biscuits are not good either, just b/c they put sugar on top doesn't make it good, sorry.  This place is highly overrated

HiJqS-VPbIO8zehvq0pLtw.text: Got the Clifton Omelette and my dad got the High Flyer. Both were simply excellent!  The "creamy dreamy grits" lived up to their name and the Clifton omelette was sensational. The oatmeal pancake as a part of the High Flyer was wonderful as well. And last but not least, the biscuit was huge and went great with the apple butter at the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Clifton Omelette with Creamy Dreamy Grits

qUllFKC1xnUiaPol5yJjww.text: As a recent transplant to the area, I tried this place my first Sunday morning in town and absolutely loved it. There are few things in life I enjoy more than a great breakfast! That being said, I have been back every Sunday since for breakfast.   An unusual selection of great foods, with great flavor. Love the chicken sausage, love the oatmeal pancakes. Good coffee too. Friendly service. I also love the decor, it's very kitschy and cool all at the same time.  I'm a fan, for certain!

2PM7qbv0N8nN0SuJrDEJ0Q.text: Visited one time so far and definitely loved it! Cannot believe I did not try it in all these years living in NC. No wonder people always had high recommendations for this place. I'm going back and definitely bringing any friends who come to visit.

e8CdCVhdZF5nkLaVMdVjcw.text: I came here for Sunday Brunch after getting a 1/2 off deal on Creative Loafing. Service and food were impeccable. Our server was so friendly and funny! We chose to sit outside as the weather was so nice in the middle of March and really enjoyed ourselves.  Only pitfall was the manager - my voucher didn't have the dollar amount printed on it for some reason, so he tried to give me $15 off, instead of $30 which is what the voucher was for. We went back and forth about it, and he was not listening to me even though I had the email that stated it was a $30 value. I understood his side, but he really should of backed off and been more aware of the deals his restaurant is offering!  He finally took care of my entire bill, which was appreciated but he did say he was doing that because "we just weren't understanding each other". A little condescending if you ask me, but whatever.   Brunch could have been ruined if it weren't for our server (Juan I think) who cracked jokes and jokingly offered to punch the manager for me, since he wasn't being nice to me at first. His attitude and helpfulness was very much appreciated and we left a nice tip on our $0 bill =)   I will go back to Flying Biscuit, as the food is great but I probably won't visit this specific location again.

id-KM1gOOtNpIvRaQlVDMg.text: The simple Flying Biscuit breakfast is a solid choice for a newcomer. Two fresh eggs and sausage patties, and not the overly seasoned or salty kind you find at Bojangles. The large biscuit with apple butter is good and flaky but not the best I've had. But the grits, oh the grits, are out of this world! They call them creamy dreamy grits, and that couldn't be any more accurate. Awesome, but prepare to pay $10 or more for breakfast. Everything on their menu could be a little cheaper in my opinion.
