Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggstra-Ordinary Breakfast
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

mnXmdq5LmV7BWt7hVZ3zUA.text: Went there for a late breakfast on a Sunday around 11am and we were able to get a table pretty quickly.  I had the steak & eggs...they did an excellent job with the food itself.  Steak was properly cooked and they did a good job on my over easy eggs.    I thought the variety of the menu overall was excellent and service was strong.  Everything was done in a timely manner and we were able to have a good meal quickly and for a VERY reasonable price.    I would recommend Flying Biscuit Cafe to anyone for breakfast food at ANY time of the day.

6QGBJIMwOeifsvd_7_8HdQ.text: I love this place for so many reasons!! The South Charlotte location has a great outdoor eating area which makes it an even better place to enjoy on a beautiful day. The food is awesome and I love that you can get breakfast around the clock. Their portions are generous and they cater to vegetarians. It's as good as it gets!

VXOo4iAXcf3cc-urUdwMVQ.text: This is our 3rd time here.  This place has an Asheville vibe.  The staff are all happy & ambitious.  The food is delivered fast, accurately, & is better for us than at most other places.  Homemade apple butter on the tables, honey instead of high fructose corn syrup jams, meatless alternatives, creative entree choices, breakfast potatoes that are baked rather than fried, very good grits, good portion sizes, and chicken sausage that is very good.  My husband typically hates chicken sausage, but actually loved it at Flying Biscuit!  Their bacon is turkey bacon & it too, is good.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

hHtpagVVy96HmZH4xIwwOg.text: Our party of 2 and a half ordered the high flyer breakfast and the turkey hash that seemed to be the most popular (and seemed to be a great prep for thanksgiving).  My companion devoured the eggs, chicken sausage, potatoes (substituted the grits) and the pancake went to the little one who had no complaints.  So I think they were good, lol.  Turkey hash was very savory and was great with the medium eggs.  The biscuit that accompanies the meal was superb- living up to its name :)   The only negative was the coffee.  Not sure if I got the last cup or it just wasn't brewed correctly, but I had to send back the coffee and opted for water.  Service was okay- nothing outstanding.  Refills were never given, but order was taken in a timely fashion and food arrived without issue.  For all these reasons,  I'm giving 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

QOYZVNOKt16BlymNTGxxig.text: This place is awesome! I am visiting Charlotte from Houston and my friend I found this location after looking for a breakfast restaurant online. We noticed it had four 1/2 stars and decided to try it out. The restaurant was busy, so that's a plus. Seating was fast we didn't have to wait. Our waitress Tila is awesome very knowledgeable  of the menu and took great care of us( she gave us complementary coffee to go ) . I had the Eggs Benedict ... Wow what a dish. It was delicious , I had Eggs Benedict before but this was excellent. I have try it with a english muffin , but with a fluffy buttermilk biscuit was even better. The eggs was poached just right and the hollandaise sauce with pimento cheese elated my taste buds. The dish has a side of creamy grits, delicious.  I highly recommend this dish to anyone. This place is excellent !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. They serve two Eggs Benedict I ate the first one before taking this pic

6F1lQSSHgc6BnCQ25aDLtw.text: My first time there cute place with outdoor seating. My breakfast was very good and the rest of my party enjoyed theirs as well service was good. I would definitely go back and recommend it to others

cAMbo8Ts8Dbgrf5xI9AB_Q.text: Love it!!! Their food is amazing, I love it! Usually textured of the food , gets me and just by looking at it I won't ever eat it, but I heard so many people say that the grits were amazing that I finally had to try it and now I order it every time I go there, their pancakes, their biscuits with jelly... yum!!! Their servers are also very nice, can't say that I had a bad experience with servers or food. Hopefully it won't ever change!!!

Gf1JjzadIubVq-NVHDlUow.text: Have been looking for a regular place to eat breakfast at a few times a week.  Stopped in here and sat at the counter. Went in around 1:30 on a weekday. They were busy, but it wasn't packed by any means. Waited 5 minutes with non-busy staff seeing me waiting and no one really taking initiative to see that I got seated. Biscuits are fantastic. This having been the third time I've eaten here, but the first time alone. The rest of the food is medicore.   The crux to make it a place that I won't return to is that the staff kept talking about regular customers to other customers. If they liked them or not...some complaining...sometimes just chat, but ultimately and separate from if me or someone else was in agreement or disagreement with any of the comments...I'd rather not become a regular if the customers are the chosen topic of conversation...even if just a one time occasion. Jugement really isn't the side order I'd prefer.

TY_O-kPGJNbXTT9sSjz6vw.text: Always a pleasure to sit down and enjoy one of my favorite meals here at the Flying Biscuit cafe. Thank you Amanda M., you make the best recommendations!!! The Stonecrest location is my favorite since it's right next to the theaters.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

xpzudLJz5ziee7Pcx7rXxA.text: I ate here today an was seated quickly. For an appetizer we had the shrimp quesadilla which was pretty good and would recommend. The meal took a turn for the worst when the main course came. For the side I order the grilled Mac and cheese which I was told what they are know for. It was the worst thing that I ate their. Would never have that again. The chicken sandwich was ok but just way to much cheese. Might try again because it was fast service but never get what I ordered again besides the quesadillas.

-IAMY9eAlZfUpwpJWAV1dg.text: I'm removing 2 stars for disorderly conduct. We arrived here on a drizzly Sunday at about 11:40. We were met by 3 teenagers at the hostess booth who looked very overwhelmed despite only a few parties waiting. We were told the wait would be about 20 minutes for 2 people and we proceeded to stand within earshot of the hostess booth while other parties arrived and those who arrived before us were seated. Once it was about time to be our turn the hostess asked if we wanted to sit outside (it was raining) or sit at the bar. I let them know that since we should be next I would continue to wait. A couple more parties arrived and were told to wait until a woman jumps out of a car and asks how long the wait would be for 3 people and the hostess responded they could seat them right away!  I kid you not. At this point I'm staring in disbelief and then a couple minutes later they finally seat us at a table right next to another empty table and I look around and there are probably 5 other empty tables around us. This is totally not acceptable behavior at a restaurant, they need to hire a host/hostess who actually knows what they're doing.  On to the actual meal. We were greeted by our waitress right away and ordered coffee. After coming back with coffee we gave our orders and our food came out in less than 5 minutes. After listening to my husband complain about them not having any real bacon, we both were happily stuffed with brunch food. We were given our check but the waitress gave us the wrong ticket. She ran away and came back with the correct check. After waiting for probably longer than it took for our food to arrive we finally paid and were able to leave. It was a confusing and flustering dining experience and they really have some organizational issues to work out.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits and gravy (turkey gravy)
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern Benedict, yummy pimento cheese!
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. So close to 4 empty tables

PaZtbfp6PzVIEG72KRz1wA.text: I came at 10:30 on a Monday morning. I sat immediately and got my food very quickly. The Breakfast Bowl was amazing! The staff was friendly and helpful. Great visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast Bowl

LSp9ioBavsWsk33r7JRydg.text: This is a great place for breakfast or brunch. This is my 2nd time here and it tastes as good as the 1st! The grits are delicious and creamy and I love the apple butter with the flying biscuit. There is usually a small wait depending on the time but it is definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

7Wae_E_A2-FFe6pc4bBG2Q.text: This place makes me happy to have moved to the neighborhood.  I could seriously eat here for three meals a day and not get bored.  I ordered perfectly on the first try - Turkey Hash.  This was amazing.  And HUGE.  As in, I took over half of it home and ate it with some fresh scrambled eggs the next day and it was somehow just as good.  It also came with a biscuit - and applebutter.  I cannot explain how happy I was to find this breakfast.  The others at my table were also happy with their biscuit, eggs, and gravy and bacon and egg breakfast.  Staff kept the coffee cups refilled constantly, I can't wait to go back.

ibB8BTiLNHR5M-QMkl0o-g.text: Everything was excellent, including the customer service. Delicious shrimp and grits. The kids' meals are large and very reasonably priced. The biscuit accompanying each meal could be a meal itself. The servers offered to go drinks and were very accommodating with take out containers. We'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Huge biscuits with sugar on top. Yum!
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits. The grits are incredible!

3FDi8XiaAJITQJyAlrwnxg.text: I love this restaurant but the management needs to recognize that this is winter.  And winter in Charlotte this morning was 25 degrees.  Your space is limited your customers understand that.  But it's 2017 and in one more day 2018.  You need to obtain a cell phone number not a name and text your customers when their table is ready.  Don't ask them to stand outside for 20 minutes because odds are we won't.  Don't lose your fans! Make a change to this century.  Thanks for listening.

tllamXOCh7mDLHILmG_F7g.text: The best grits in charlotte hands down!! Give them a try.. you will not be sorry at all!!

oQ9qbk3EN8REV5XEQiAhVw.text: The most disgusting food I've ever eaten. The bun on my BLT reminded me of the one's we got in elementary school...stale, tasteless, and had a texture of sandpaper. The staff could be heard and seen arguing about tables, who was sat next, who wanted to get lunch, etc. uncomfortable and awkward vibe.

_Nwl2q_mRuPrT_J1rt14Ow.text: No need for a long review. I was impressed here with the service and the food. Also, I was pleasantly surprised by the price, not too bad for a cool little lunch spot. The turkey meatloaf was just what the doctor ordered.

ZOJ75G3rVC_tov4JeovLFA.text: Never been here before.   Always wanted to try it.   When we walked in, we were a little confused. Didn't know if we needed to seat ourselves or wait.  No one acknowledged us, so we sat ourselves.    One person was working the floor.  She did a decent job.   Ordered the fish taco that was tasteless.  The sauteed green beans were ok.  Not really cooked enough.    I wasn't blown away by the food.  I have no intention coming back.

56doHH3SOxZElCMHyXc9ig.text: Update: The "moon-dusted" potatoes are in fact NOT VEGAN. Good experience, good service!

RgAAf7Lfggp58J9bbKWLfw.text: Fast service and great breakfast. Have eaten here multiple times and have never been disappointed. Even with a massive line on Sunday's they seem to keep things moving. Large portions. I love their biscuit and gravy with scrambled eggs, i usually sub fruit instead of grits so it isn't so heavy. Love it. Servers have always been attentive and friendly.

TAWMo_b9B9i3r4smVDXAOg.text: Had veggie devil burger. It says it's spicy but it was not that spicy. Had garlic and basil mash patota. Mash potato was yummy. Will try it again

6srAIZ4mdZsr7wkrXxVD5w.text: Had the turkey burger, which was very tasty.  Biscuits were very large and pretty good but not great.  Potatoes are to die for.  I'll be back.

Nc7eF4KkWsl3GhKQ3c3r9g.text: I love the biscuits and apple butter! Oh, and I'll take a side of grits with that!  I eat the Hollywood omelet -- so I can sort of justify eating all the other sides. The place is a really cute - you kind of forget that it is a chain.

tg-5wvq_79zL7wXuh2wSqg.text: Incredible breakfast menu!  Their biscuits are worth the trip just be prepared to wait for a table on Sunday mornings after 10am.

2l-JPZNILAAwvYVEj6U1YA.text: Went to meet some friends for lunch the other day. It was pretty busy as our waitress informed us after it took a while to get our drinks (which we were still one drink shy). Based on the food, you would think they would be used to being busy especially around noon. i chose the Meggxican Wrap and it was delicious. The side of potatoes were good, they had a little spice to them, but they seemed a little dry. i sampled some Pomodoro Chicken and would probably try that next time, it was tasty.   At a table of 6, everyone was happy with their food choice (even when one member of our party didn't get his side of french toast until the very end of the meal after a 2nd reminder, they were apparently still delicious. (4.5 stars worth), If we hadn't been a table in no rush to be anywhere and full of very patient people, i could see people getting upset with their service on this visit.   Price for three people came to around $33 plus tip. It was a fun place with great food. We'll probably try it again someday and perhaps at a less busy time, they'll get the 4 stars their food deserves.

lyI4FQ95mFLHbWK0qGEYBQ.text: My husband and I ordered take-out from this restaurant which was our first time eating here. There was only one number listed on their menu but when we went to go pick up our order, they said they didn't have any order for us. The hostess said that number was for their Southpark location. WEIRD! Why would they have one number listed on their menu with no location information? How is one to know that it was for another location? So we re-ordered. They were able to get us our order very quickly.  I gave this place 3 stars but I really would have preferred to give them 4. The reason they only received 3 stars is because their dining room is really small and their staff isn't very organized or friendly. This is a very busy restaurant (Ballantyne area) and the minute you walk in the hostess station is staring you in the fee. This  causes a traffic jam of people going in different directions in and out of the door. People sit there with the door open not able to allow others to walk out. The hostess was a deer in headlights and wasn't friendly at all.  On a good note, the food was fantastic. I ordered the Orange French Toast with raspberry sauce and an order of the sage chicken sausage. Although, there wasn't anything orange about it which was disappointing. The French Toast itself was just ok but the sauces made up for it. My husband got the fried egg sandwich with potatoes and biscuit. Everything was very fresh and delicious. I would say that if you can handle rude people and crowds, you have to eat here since the food is good. I would prefer to eat it in my car to not have to deal with the people and dining room.

YlVuPBW7avHVM5IzB75GXA.text: I expected better because of the good rating. The waitress took my order late. Food was mediocre. My cup of fruit didn't come at all until I asked for it and even then that took a while. Also there were grounds in my coffee. I would have been better off going to IHOP.

LQjLWXWCusNvPcpXbt3ShA.text: Nothing stellar. Perhaps if I went here for breakfast, but if this place is "so great" about its breakfast fare, 1) why serve anything other than breakfast menu? and 2) why be open to serve dinner?  I walked in and thought I was in some cheap garage birthday party. Dare we sit down?  The sweet tea was rather off-tasting, as if a rotten lemon was in it for days or it was brewed 10 days ago. And the waiter...or should I say waiter, waiter-manager and owner. Can I not be hounded by everyone as they walk by our table?  I've never had someone ask me, "How do you want your fish cooked?" at a restaurant.  Overall, not impressed, and collectively, our table joked that it would have been worth to walk over to Wendy's for a meal rather than trying out this eatery.

sQR8H14c4Gek77514pB-7A.text: I like to go here with my two sons (6yrs & 9yrs). They love the Kids Menu breakfast items. Perfect size & price for kids. The grits are amazing. I have never been a fan of grits but really like the grits here. I like that I can substitute Egg Whites or Tofu for many of the ingredients. We love to sit at the bar. Usually no wait compared to the wait for tables at times. My go-to place for Breakfast or Brunch! (Breakfast served all day too)

oXIPysOrXN4HSenZNDZMxg.text: The Flying dry and hard Biscuit. Where the customer is wrong Good Afternoon, My wife and I came there to have a birthday breakfast. Upon arriving we were told to sit anywhere so we did. Our waitress got us coffee then took 15 minutes to get our order. By the way you should make fresh coffee and perhaps taste it before giving it to your guest. Finally we get to place our order. My wife got the flying biscuit breakfast. The only edible item on the plate were the eggs, even though they were over scrambled. The house potatoes were mushy and cold. I got the high flyer. I ordered my eggs over easy and they were way under done. So I told the waitress politely. Her response was "well those are over easy and the whites should be runny like that, you should get them over medium because that is probably what you wanted". First off, never respond that way to a clients complaint. 2nd don't try and tell someone they don't know what they are ordering. Your chicken sausages that are supposedly your signature. I didn't know that signature means frozen from a package. The biscuits were like biting into chalk. They are dry and hard. I still got charged for my breakfast and also had to tell the waitress she forgot to charge for the OJ. Her response was "I always do that if someone orders something during there meal". I didn't know that I only had 1 time to order and thats final. My fault once again. With all that being said the manager was never made aware of our problem. Not once did he come over and ask how is everything. Whats funny about that is he was expediting food so you would think he would have seen a re fire. Uh oh no COMMUNICATION. If your expo, you are the last line of defense to make sure the food goes out properly and hot. Or is your manager just a worker. I can fix the problems let me know. The Real Critic NC therealcriticnc@gmail.com

PBHUPhykYDZlSUCLD9zu1Q.text: I'm only giving my experience 1 star because 0 stars is not an option. Whoever  said it's impossible to screw up breakfast has obviously never been here. We ate here on Sunday morning two weeks ago. We were seated outside on the patio (our mistake due to the scorching heat) and no one acknowledged us for at least 15-20 mins. We saw many other tables over the course of our meal receive the same treatment (ignored).   The server who finally acknowledged us to take our drink orders was super rude and not at all pleasant. The sweet tea tasted terrible. We first incorrectly received unsweet tea, only then to nicely ask if we could get sweet tea. The sweet tea was not any better--- sour. It was probably another 30 mins before the food came out. It felt like an eternity.  The food we received was nothing short of awful. I really try to be kind, but the 'healthy sausage' (only sausage option they had) was completely impossible to even chew. The biscuits were rock hard. I could go on and on, but nothing was good. For the prices they charge, I expect the food to at least be halfway decent.  The food was also very cold.  I have been to other Flying Biscuit Cafe's in other cities, and they have been decent. They at least bring a warm basket of biscuits while you wait. If I were you, I would stay away from this place. This business will not survive if they continue on this track.

IaUqxZ0dEUc3j-CCFBIzZQ.text: Sullen waitress Renee after asking if we were ready to order dinner for the 2nd time simply walked away without comment when my friend and I asked for just a few minutes more.       When I asked if I could substitute Collard Greens in place of the included salad I was met with annoyance.  Upon receiving our meals, Shrimp and Grits and the Black Bean Quesadilla, Renee did not serve the "infamous mile-high biscuits" until we had to ask for them!  The were undercooked, underwhelming and dry- served with nothing but the apple butter that was in a squeeze-bottle on the table.      My dish should have been labeled "Grits with Shrimp Garnish" while my friend's dry quesadilla had a garnish of a completely inappropriate sweet sauce on top, no salsa and extremely dry, tasteless, salty potato cubes, possibly straight from the Cisco frozen section.  When Renee was asked if a side of salsa was possible we were given a hot tiny container of tomato pomodoro sauce-  the farthest thing from salsa imaginable.     The collards were basically inedible and were seasoned with so much MSG-laden spice that I immediately had a coughing fit-  no hint of bacon or ham as one would expect from southern greens.  Renee and another server simply snickered in the back of the restaurant at this and never replenished drinks or water.      We were never offered dessert but rather presented with the check and lamely told about some charity "cherry" on some random desert by Renee.  I would never go back to this "restaurant" due to quality of food and there-lack-of of service!

VHLfaSdFMWEZbRPHFeTHKA.text: My husband brought me here for breakfast on my birthday.  We loved the cute decor but the food was sub par.  I was really disappointed in their grits - he brought me there because we were looking for some good southern grits.  I have definitely had better as these were way too buttery and salty tasting.  The biscuits and apple butter were wonderful!  I could have just eaten a couple of those and been content.  Service was good, food was okay.  I would possibly go back for a biscuit someday.

Asj9zpXGThhwpATROt95KA.text: Well, after living in Ballantyne for years and hearing all the hub-bub about this place, and seeing the lines on the weekend, I finally tried it recently, and I must say, I was amazingly UNDER-whelmed.  The interior feels like a Cracker Barrell, complete with small tables and uncomfortable chairs.  Our table was in a back dark corner near the kitchen door, so it was loud and busy.  The breakfast I ordered has a little bit of everything on it, so I could try it all.  To be honest, I have had a better breakfast at IHOP.   The eggs were super dry, the pancakes were even drier, and had no flavor, the bacon was undercooked and skimpy, and oddly enough, the biscuits were hard like rocks and so dry that no amount of butter would rescue them. Even the hash browns/home fries were undercooked and boring.  For the price and the crowds, there are dozens of breakfast places in this area that are WAY better.  Still not sure what all the hype is about....have all you people in line not tried any place else???

B-jhtqwaEIJitJFrhBA0SQ.text: Wow, the grits were like a savory pudding! I've never had grits anything like this before. And the oatmeal pancake with peach compote was mind blowing too. Actually everything I had from the Flying Biscuit Cafe was out of control! So good! You MUST try the grits. You know, I can't remember the name of the meal I ordered, but it was on the breakfast menu, second down from the top in the left column. Whatever that is, ORDER IT!  It came with eggs, biscuit, jelly, chicken sausage, grits, and oatmeal pancake with peach compote.  You will not be sorry! And it's a meal definitely big enough to share, if you're into that sort of thing!

pQ6qUfU1ZiNta7_WFz2l2Q.text: Solid breakfast place!  I've never had grits before and decided to try them at breakfast today as I heard they were good at Flying Biscuit!  YUMMM!  The biscuit was pretty yummy too.  The service was great and the wait wasn't too long despite the big crowd waiting for tables on a busy Sunday.  Will definitely go back! :)

RiEN_zYk1X5S-iHKS3G4Iw.text: My family and I ate here last week.  We all agreed that we'll be back.  I had the biscuits and gravy - they were probably the best I've ever had!  The bacon was the only disappointment in the whole meal and the only reason I didn't give them a 5 star.

7I8qvu7-VY-dWTUDkOWmOw.text: They get one star for friendly service and the cold beer. As for the food... My burrito wasn't fresh and the grits were a big let down, soupy, too much cream and no texture, obviously old. The shop itself is cool with a good atmosphere.

cWD-DUor1oOdMP6n-rlmIg.text: When you go don't forget to order a side of love... Fantastic!  I've been there now about a dozen times in the year I've been here and I've never had a meal that I didn't thoroughly enjoy.

8PZ6O8Vszofnsuuz7pWauA.text: When you walk into a place trying this hard not to look corporate, it inevitably comes off in a creepy way. When you know that the place used to be a breakfast fixture in Atlanta known for it's organic, vegetarian-friendly, comfy, yet artful takes on breakfast and lunch, and has since had it's aesthetic, menu, and "feel" appropriated and mass produced, its difficult to enjoy it. For me, anyway. Despite the awesome tomatillo salsa and black bean cakes smothered in Queso Fresco. Even though we had a great waitress. This style of food is being purveyed by a number of places in Charlotte, often less expensively, by culinary entrepreneurs, so I guess my question is, why go to a chain?

GM3RISwY4WKlky2cY2s1Rg.text: This new location is just as good as the one in Atlanta, thank god!!  The eggseptional eggs are so good you'll want to slap your mother (who ever decided to put tomatillo salsa on eggs deserves a comendation).  I'm sure I will get some flack for this, but the biscuit is the most disappointing part of the meal- way to bready, like they weren't friends with butter.  The rosemary potatoes make up for the biscky though.  Now all they need to do is open one that isn't in the stupid suburbs...

rJrKbdyXFGEKnlgQm9gnog.text: I wish I could give 5 stars to The Flying Biscuit but the absolutely horrible waitress forbids me from doing that! I arrived one minute before my friend and the waitress hollered from the bar area to the door where I stood waiting to be seated "just one?" I realized she was "speaking" to me and I indicated there would be two. She hustled me to a table and promptly left. Another server (not sure of his name) brought me a water and anticipated that my friend may want a water too. My friend arrived as he delivered my water and asked what she would like to drink and she opted for water(which he anticipated). My friend and I began talking as we hadn't seen each other in quite some time. Susan, our server, came about one minute after my friend sat down and asked if we were ready to order. We asked for another minute. Fifteen minutes later Susan finally decided to come back and take our order. She gave me different option to pick from for the meal I order without telling me there was an uncharged for the bacon or that if I order fruit for which she gave me the choice I wouldn't get the grits that the menu stated clearly came with my meal. Our meal came promptly. Our server never came back to the table until she tried to take my friends meal in which she wasn't even finished eating. I had to ask another server to fill my water which I had been sucking dry for about five minutes already. Susan may have wondered why she didn't receive a decent tip from me, well if I had received decent service from her she would have gotten a decent tip. She didn't even deserve what she got. Not sure that I'll be visiting The Flying Biscuit any time in the near future!

QzbQg8LFK-zCAVAMPnK4tQ.text: I don't get the Flying Biscuit Cafe hype.  I have eaten there only one time but am not sure I'll go back.  It wasn't bad per se but it wasn't great either.  I did not like my biscuit - it lacked flavor and was dry.   The chicken sausage was meh and the eggs were burned.  The grits were pretty good but nothing to write home about.  The service wasn't particularly great either.    On a side note, I was a little disappointed they have only turkey bacon on the menu.  I rarely eat bacon but definitely enjoy a nice thick slab of it with breakfast every now and then.  Turkey bacon just doesn't do it for me.

6ERtQm96LI9uPYRInMN-vQ.text: I haven't stopped talking about their chocolate chip pancakes since I ate them yesterday morning!  I don't know that I've ever had pancakes better than this.  The 3, 8" diameter cakes are enough for 2 - I was only able to take a small bite of the included biscuit.  We arrived at 8:45am on Saturday, and there wasn't a wait.  When we left, seats were still available.

RKGjXoiZM8EaJWSKXfwUkA.text: A chain restaurant trying to be a crunchy, neighborhood, natural diner.  That's really what it is... It's not horrible, but it isn't great.  For those of you living in Ballantyne, you know that there is a horrible lack of breakfast places, so we do with what we have.    First, the biscuits are not good, nor do they fly.  They aren't really like biscuits at all, actually.  I have tried the shrimp and grits, scrambles, straight egg breakfasts, and black bean cakes.  The grits are creamy and heavy, not bad if you don't mind the richness.  The black bean cakes were pretty good, everything else was just okay.  I usually don't let surroundings get to me, but I kinda have with this place.  I find myself eating here often because of my veggie Mom and friends that enjoy it..  I never seem to like it for some reason...     You know what it is?  It's that this restaurant is a corporate version of something that I really like... the neighborhood hippie diner.   There are a lot of businesses that do this really well and I guess I was expecting that.

7XsD6G3kONmCAyZatc32Hg.text: This is definitely one of my favorite low key places to eat in Charlotte! The fried green tomatoes with the cashew-jalapeno relish and goat cheese are incredibly tasty. My usual favorite from here is the warm chicken salad, which never disappoints even when I get it to go if I don't have time to dine in. And who could forget the biscuits with the apple butter?   Some people may criticize the prices and sometimes say that the service isn't fabulous, but this place and its waitstaff have never disappointed me! Kudos to the Flying Biscuit at Stonecrest! :)

mmqwWfobLRhcRqIfmht8bA.text: Fun, quirky little place that focuses primarily on breakfast. This place is pretty popular and we went on high recommendations from friends. In all my own impressions were mixed.  Firstly, the menu- lots of good alternative, healthy offerings of traditional breakfast fare (think turkey bacon and whole-wheat pancakes). Which was a nice change. Other than that, not too much to rave about here. The food, while good, was overpriced for what it was.   Secondly, service. Service was quick, but not terribly attentive after we received our food (we went a long period without drink refills).  In all they weren't bad and I'm glad we finally gave them a try- but I doubt we'll be in any hurry to go back. My breakfast cravings lean much more toward the Park 51 Cafe, closer to home.

HogxP0bzlBPU7_vTj2g5xQ.text: I love the Southern Scramble, it's good stuff!  Best I can remember it's scrambled eggs, turkey bacon, cheese, and collard greens all mixed together.  The creamy grits are delightful and the biscuits are always fresh.  The coffee is good and strong, just the way I like it.  Plus, if you are there with a friend you can share a plate with them for a $1 or $2 extra in which you'll each get a biscuit, etc.  Great place for breakfast!

D-Mxw0I2zTn6GBlOCPEvkA.text: POW!   The Flying Biscuit Cafe gets a top-rope flying high five from me. Maybe folks in the south are spoiled with breakfast spots unlike I am in the Midwest - but damn ya'll, this place is outstanding. First off, the whole menu is served all day long.   I decided to start of with a Sledgehammer, nice name for a drink with four shots of espresso. This thing was a perfect fix for my late evening and early morning (not my idea to get up early!) I sat on the patio and fired up the laptop (yes, free wifi) to send off a few emails.   The service was great, attentive and friendly. I got the High Flyer over-easy which comes with an array of vegetables, a few eggs, a biscuit (duh!), grits and a pancake with peach compote. My reason for the early morning ordered the shrimp and grits & a bowl of tomato basil soup. Sounded a bit odd to me too, given the 830a hour.   The food came quickly and was served piping hot! +1! I enjoyed everything on my side of the table even the grits which seem to be made different in every part of the country. Even the lower carolina doesn't make them the same as NC. The biscuits didn't wow me nor disappoint me, and are served with a spicy jam.   I will be back again - I think. Unless there are just that many good breakfast stops in Charlotte. If this is one of the least appetizing, I can't wait to sink my teeth into the best!

1zPDrWuO1aDHuioXvh_3YA.text: This is a must-go-to breakfast place in Charlotte!  This location has great outdoor seating and the service is great.    I am a huge fan of the cajun chicken scramble.  It is absolutely delicious.  The first time I ordered it, I went with the breakfast potatoes....HUGE MISTAKE!!!!! The grits are the BEST grits I have ever tasted and I have converted many anti-grit northerners with these grits.  However, I am not a fan of the biscuits...I feel as if the proper name for this place would be The Flying Grits!    Either way, this is a must try for anyone visiting or living in the Charlotte area.  Very good atmosphere...kind of a creative, house of blues atmosphere that can make anyone feel comfortable.

OjMVXybDrqmOP_FGgDWxzA.text: Unlike most Charlotte establishments this place is pork lite which makes it a heavy hitter in my book. The have a wonderful tofu scramble, the fried green tomatoes are a good way to start and the turkey bacon option is always smile worthy.   Sure it's a coporation dressed up to look like an independently owned diner but hey, we live in America where Starbucks is king so i won't hold that against them.   Order the whole wheat biscuit to feel better about yourself while you slather it with apple butter and then feel your arteries thank you for not clogging them with brunch!

CxV1voX-xbcH50o8CUCB2Q.text: Vegan BBQ Burrito was delicious. Potatoes needed more flavor. Grits were fantastically rich. Coffee was hot and fresh. Waitress was friendly but slow. Location in shopping plaza across the lot from Target means lots of parking. Kept me full the entire day, plus my uneaten biscuit for lunch the next day. Not bad.

wmVpUYQkBtSdcJn78fBSJg.text: Excellent service and one of the absolute best bowls of grits I have ever tasted - menu was missing some flexibility but other than that this is a great place for a really good breakfast-

0c6sxR-lyz_YqdjK1Gi2-w.text: Okay, imagine opening up a can of condensed cream of chicken and vegetable soup, no water added, plopped into a bowl with a biscuit on the side -  that's your  chicken pot pie at flying biscuit cafe. My suggestion to the owner - if you actually cook the food yourself, you will have people coming to your restaurant. I should've known better- 5:30 on a Friday night, one table taken. Just Noodles next door packed.

8YCR1ef6m9_mkkbUv3mCRw.text: This place is great! Best grits ever! The biscuits are awesome as well. I've ordered the fried green tomatoes & didn't love that dish. I've also had the French toast & it wasn't anything special. That being said, the turkey pot pie is amazing & I just love the feel of the restaurant.

KSBioxM149ZhqWcDTx12kA.text: Without any sugar coating. I would say this place has issues with consistency. Its a shame, because when this place is good, it flies. But when its not beware, its pretty bad. Due to my diet, I'm usually stuck with two dishes here: The salmon, or the Cajun egg scramble. [Subbing out the grits or potatoes] Typically when they screw up, its with the salmon. It seems that they can cook it perfectly, or they can dry it out like none other. Additionally, it seems there is a bad system about getting biscuits out at the right time. When I first started coming here, the biscuits came out before the meal, but that only happens half the time now. [The other half is that they come out with the meal]  Tip: If you get the Cajun egg scramble, ask for it to be without the sour cream. The sour cream dampens the spice.  Reader's note: I've eaten here more than 15 times. Its not the worst place in the world, but they sure could fix the consistency issues.

nGfNWh5oB1E1zuShig8LlA.text: This place is great. For my birthday, I just wanted to have breakfast somewhere where I could sit on the patio and relax...and this is where I ended up. The first thing I ordered, was not to my liking, so I just went with the basics...biscuits, bacon and sausage. The apple butter was delicious! I will gladly go back!

eOoegzHJC2RYYxRKKjZaAA.text: Four star breakfast in Charlotte for sure. The biscuits are fluffy on the inside and crunchy on the outside, just the way I like them.   I had the Hollywood omelet with a fruit cup on the side and it was as expected, perfect. My wife got the high flyer and it came with an oatmeal pancake that had a peach syrup side that was as good as it gets.   No negatives for service because if you have good conversation at the table you shouldn't care about waiting for GREAT food. The place was packed and they were on their game.   Definitely try this place and you'll make it a frequent stop as we do when we are in the area.

upTr0xCVIKe_sVYItH_cNQ.text: I have never been disappointed! Their oatmeal pancakes are very good. I also love their rosemary potatoes. I have always had excellent service but the wait can be long on the weekends.

UetY4sQKIOOO7YoT9orp2w.text: I enjoy going to the FB. We visited yesterday morning after a 10k race we participated in so needless to say we were HUNGRY! We were greeted by the hostess at the outside hostess stand (good thing it wasn't raining) and promptly seated. Our food was very good. My guest had the veggie scramble (she loved it) and I had the warm chicken salad. Crazy ordering a salad after a race but it's one of my favorite entrees on the menu. Their biscuits are good definitely NOT your typical Southern Biscuit. They are light and fluffy but not buttery, more on the dry side and sprinkled with sugar. They are very good with honey. I can't comment on the Apple Butter because I don't like Apple Butter. I think of AB to be a crime against nature. I like apples in their natural form. So with that being said, we did not ask for it BUT I have heard nothing but great things about the AB, if that's what you are into.  The service was not great yesterday. It's been better in the past. We had to ask repeatedly for more coffee and water. We also had to swipe a bowl of creamers from another table because our waitress was nowhere to be found and we had to ask for honey. And last but not least we had to take our check up to the bar to pay because again the waitress was nowhere to be found. I would have cut her some slack had the place been busy but by this time the breakfast crowd was gone.

65L2fTgqAwQrifBkg23l-A.text: Love the veggie scramble.  Also a place my children enjoy.  Quick and friendly service.

ceokbXdGFpk1ws0xSoB4rA.text: Hadn't been here in a long time.  Today was rainy and cold and this little cafe was close to home.  I was reminded that it is cute and cozy with impeccable service.  It's all almost too good to be True.  Breakfast is always served here and I opted for an egg white omelet with mushrooms and tomatoes and cheese.  Of course, the best thing on the plate was the biscuit.  It did fly, by the way, right down my mouth. And the squeeze bottle of apple butter made it fly faster.   There are a lot of great options on the menu and they cater to people who are gluten sensitive.  The Christmas music was ringing a bit too loudly for my liking, but everything else was picture perfect.   Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

UC6g1Dmdt4QLitoAMPSoqg.text: So the space and service received were nice, probably above average. No complaints there. One big positive I can say is that the kid's menu is excellently priced, though portions reflect that. But still, not bad for kid's menu.  Unfortunately, I can't say I was impressed with my meal, or the wife with her's. I had the biscuits and gravy and it just wasn't that great to me. I'd say everything was fine, somewhat plain. The thing that threw me off was the biscuit had a sugar top and it mixed poorly with the rest of the meal. Just off-putting to me, maybe that's their signature thing though. The grits that came with the meal were great though.   Overall, just think there are better places out there. I likely won't be back, but not because of the service or staff.

mmvxepc7iNKVDZm5VMvEKQ.text: I haven't been here in quite some time only because it's not exactly close to home, but I was in the area today so decided to stop in. It's just as good as I remembered. I tried the southern scramble (spicy collards, cheddar cheese, bacon and onions) for the first time and it was oh so delish! Of course no meal is complete without the biscuit and apple butter to accompany it!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

dgsLUfwBQrM8XCAq0X77xA.text: It's been 4 months since I last tried this popular South Charlotte joint. My four prior experiences had all been disappointing and my review reflected that; however, I really want to like this place. So here it goes again...  I went for lunch and ordered day Love Cakes once again from their incredibly appealing menu. They serve breakfast and lunch by the way. For the first time, they arrived hot and tasty. The dish is topped with red onions, sour cream, a light salsa and an excellent tomatillo sauce. It comes with a salad but I ordered the fried mac and cheese instead. Very original and very popular. The biscuit itself was hot and delicious.  My friend ordered two eggs over turkey hash from one of the best breakfast menus around. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the hash was superb. I may order it again myself.  Unfortunately, the service was still lacking, which I think was simply due to being understaffed. They had an impressive 97 sanitary rating and the atmosphere is very cozy. They also have excellent outside seating.  Very pleased with the improvements from my last visit here, it's like I said this place is only a half a mile from home, I really want to like it. It's not Gotta Try yet, but I do look to trying it again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey Hash
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Love Cakes
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice outside dining option

_HyWdDAiQDNW1F_hzLAKFw.text: I found this place to be crowded, no menu item iwe ordered even met expectation let alone wowing us. Even biscuits were mediocre. Would not go again.

rv2R-sFTU3TXbRitIZ8qIQ.text: Girl, I ain't never had food this bad and I've had some bad food before. Tell me why the potatoes taste like when you buy freezer hash browns, accidentally leave them open in your freezer, cook them, and then wait thirty minutes before eating.  Pancakes were cold and tasted like biscuits, how that work? And why is this place so tiny? I do not recommend.

SUzdjhMBwyCzqTUQCXVD8Q.text: Seated by bathroom. Why I don't know especially when other seats were available. Waitress was very short and so rude that my husband and I didn't order buy decided to let the kids bc they wanted to eat there. Between the waitress and the kitchen, the order wasn't correct. Another waitress informed the manager about what happened and he quickly comped the meal and apologized. This was very nice and is what all restaurants should do in the event service is not up to par. We won't be returning to this location.

d72og2IeQxnPt1NJYqzJ5g.text: Love the Flying Biscuit! Every time I'm in Charlotte I make sure to get a meal there. The biscuits are to die for. The grits are the creamiest,and of course the dreamiest, grits I ever had. My go-to meal is  the Southern Scramble. Yet, this time I had the Egg-Stravaganza, which was delish! And to drink a vanilla chai latte with soy milk. After writing this review, I think a trip to Charlotte is past due.

37kBkGINWqpCizjif5Blug.text: Had brunch at the Flying Biscuit today and was so surprised at how amazing the food was. The place is small, and was very busy, but that is to be expected on a Sunday morning in Charlotte. The restaurant has a very eclectic and cozy feel. I ordered the two eggs, biscuit and gravy combo and it was amazing. The gravy is made with chicken sausage, which I was initially not sure about but it is some of the best gravy I've ever had on biscuits. The biscuits were also made perfectly, crunchy on the outside but so soft on the inside, you can cut them with a fork. Will definitely return!

tVnLfnwR7OwlqOPaVHxnhw.text: Great service however the food was not good at all. I ordered the French toast and it was basically wheat bread with raspberry jelly. I promptly changed the order to pancakes instead and that was just a slight upgrade. Omelette was not anything special and the potatoes were not hot. Everyone was pretty underwhelmed with their meal except for the shrimp and grits that seemed to be perfect! Been to many other breakfast places that were way better. I will not be back here.

tHuQtABw6E_41mEPgSsZmg.text: Food was better than average but not great.  Surprised that I needed to add salt and butter to our grits.  Food should be seasoned by the cook!  Food is sitting under heat lamp on line far too long. Servers and line folk need to talk more.   Spicy collards arent spicy.  They're smoky, but no kick at all. Biscuits sat out for too long, not great.

3PiLvViWhS8b9JOBeTZq6w.text: Small venue but was able to be seated with whole party of 7. Food is good. Lots of choices. Kids choice had variety.

xPUm3HgeEQMzb9MoGvqCfQ.text: A co worker ordered takeout and because her food had an amazing aroma I decided to try Flying Biscuit Cafe. I don't know if I came on a bad day but the service and the food was well below expectations. I was seated immediately upon arriving, however it took about 15 minutes for someone to take my drink order. Then another 10 minutes for a different waitress to take my food order. If the restaurant had been busy it would have been understandable. I ordered turkey bacon because I don't eat pork, but was still given pork bacon. I sent it back, instead of them making another plate, they removed the pork bacon replaced it with turkey. At this point I was overwhelmed with how long it took and my food. I got a to go plate and ended up throwing the food away. A waste of time and money

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

bEKOY-dx_qwXl3T-JxcFgw.text: Ate there today.  A soldier three stars.  Seated quickly. Our waitress was nice enough, but hurried.  She walked away while we were still ordering drinks and again during Our food order. She just turned and left while we were still talking lol.  Food came out pretty quickly.  Grits were very good. I appreciated the vegan and gluten free options. They gluten free was discussed pretty carefully.  Always nice to feel comfortable about them Understanding food allergies.  My only real complaint was with the biscuit. It as a bit hard and cold.  I had really Been looking forward to that.  Cracker Barrel has a much better biscuit.  They do have a nice varied menu. I would go back. Coffee was good, too.

EruB4e2fMhSLpMV_ii_jEA.text: Disgusting!!! I don't know how this place has good reviews. I usually can tell how good the food will be based on the cleanliness of the restroom. I'm not sure why that's the case...maybe a demonstration of "attention to details." The restroom was nasty and so was the food!

9U-mkBlYvniH7eKhNXi_sg.text: This is one of our favorite brunch places! We are not usually huge grit eaters, but they have easily the best grits I've ever had. I always get the breakfast bowl, and the portion is good for the price! We usually have to wait to be seated, but it is worth the wait! My favorite thing, however, is the biscuits and apple butter. Oh. My. God. They are amazing and oh so fluffy!! Come here for an amazing, hearty breakfast/ brunch and awesome service!

QysFWpbClzw33S8Uv7z4rA.text: Very hard to get into on a Sat. Or Sun. Morning so we are here having breakfast for dinner.   Biscuits and gravy with eggs and grits-ok. Biscuit Benedict with grits-ok  Wait staff is very attentive. Country theme with outside seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar and biscuits!!

oNT8VEhh5jDh57WgfiYJzQ.text: Food was good and the server was nice, he kind of forgot to come and check on us until the end to offer coffee refills or water. But Wow!!!! $3.99 for 2 slices of avocado!!!!! If you are going to charge that, you should better give me the whole avocado!!!!

SasWD874Y5sCpjNaXhNGeQ.text: Came here for takeout one night.  Food was ok, staff was incredibly rude and unprofessional. Younger girl behind the bar complained because someone on the phone ordering didn't know the menu inside and out.  Seemed more like, she just wasn't happy with her job and probably shouldn't be working in customer service.  I'd be embarrassed if this was my establishment and my employee was speaking that way in front of other customers.

7W76Zgo48DgMmk8Vscs2WA.text: Mmmm biscuits that can fly. I came here one morning because I heard about the amazing biscuits that can hover. It's weird because they don't have wings. I saw someone throw a biscuit into the air that was some pretty cool flying action. Food was excellent.

cfvEQh7SGgrMYblHM3VZ9Q.text: Went here today with my girl.   Nice morning so we sat outside and was looking forward to a good bfast.   Got the turkey hash after the waitress recommended it.  Ordered a side of grits.  Grits were good.  Everything else was awefull. Eggs no seasoning and overcooked.  Potatoes were soggy and Tasted strange.  Turkey tasted like it was a couple days old.  Worst of all the biscuit was like a rock and had no taste.  I mean the name is the flying biscuit......how can you mess up the biscuit.  My girls food tasted bad too.   She ordered the southern eggs or whatever they call it...had collard greens in it......she was very disappointed.   Total waste of 35 bucks.  Will never be back.   Spend ur money somewhere else.

cCOtGzXdw0UQwk55PZp4kQ.text: Hubby and I went there for breakfast yesterday.  I ordered French Toast.  It was soggy, with strawberry syrup on top. It was not French Toast.  I ordered bacon, too.  I don't know what they're trying to pass off as bacon . . . maybe turkey bacon?  Anyway, it was yucky, and it was not bacon.  So, I sent the bacon back.  And when I did, the waitress gave me 'the look'.  Hubby ordered the Oatmeal Pancake and was not thrilled with it either.  We have been there before, and it was not this bad.  We paid over $17 for a piece of soggy French Toast, an oatmeal pancake and 1 cup of coffee (which was never refilled).  With all the choices in CLT, I doubt we'll be stung here again.

S8m-HrW-sGU4_8vDB1u-6Q.text: Best Breakfast All Day!  The Flying Biscuit is by far the best breakfast place in Charlotte.  From their oatmeal pancakes to dreamy grits, the meals are always delicious!  I love their creative menu, and the fact that it's very vegetarian-friendly.  If you avoid red meat, you can still enjoy the chicken sausage or turkey bacon.  (Nice to feel guilt-free after eating sausage and bacon!)  Not only is the food delish, but it's a great value for huge portions.  Almost every meal includes one the the famous 'flying biscuits' which is sprinkled with sugar. Yummmm!  The Flying Biscuit does offer lunch and dinner--the shrimp and grits is a personal fave--but breakfast is their forte.  I'd say that anyone who hasn't absolutely loved this place, hasn't tried the breakfast.  Go for the best they offer and you will not be disappointed!

FjaCQ6dUFF4b31FCF8UWcQ.text: Dropped by here with the family on a busy Sunday morning - we've been here before but I've always forgotten to post a review!! This time I will not be denied!  Anyway, we had a fairly short wait and were seated - service here is usually pretty good. They realize that you don't mess with someone on short sleep who needs coffee (or kids who need their milk and biscuit stat!)  Kids ordered chocolate chip pancakes and the chicken sausage patties (both very tasty!). I ordered the Clifton omlette with the heavenly grits and my better half ordered the Hollywood omlette, also with the grits. These grits are sublime, they actually make people crave them! The omlettes were both very good (especially the tomato sauce that comes with both!) Of course we all got the biscuits, which are giant and come with spicy apple butter (I'm a fan)  Price-wise this place isn't cheap, which is my main objection - my personal opinion is that breakfast should never be more than $10/pp and Flying Biscuit blows that premise. However, the food can't be beat and they offer enough healthy options that you feel good eating there.

hDLC5TT17J3Ak2t7cWyWiA.text: This is my second visit.the food is good the service is ok. good location ! scrumble eggs and and biscuit is my first choice one here

PH3V2ugtc704qAFa_YBmTw.text: I love coming here when I visit my family in Charlotte! The bean cakes are delicious!!! The biscuits are to die for!!!

_Rwr6ObHtbPOUMlwehVNqA.text: The chicken sausage biscuits and gravy are amazing!  My daughter loved the kids French toast with the vanilla cream dipping sauce also.  This was a win!!

W0C6ZjuwjkEi3cjH0HdL8Q.text: I visited the original location first and a few months later stumbled upon this location while out with my husband. This place is great. The wait can be pretty long but it is worth it. The shrimp & grits are heavenly and their pancakes are wHOO! Great!

vvp_GwmZDEZNQ1b0bk1FyA.text: I can take this place or leave it. I went there for lunch with some coworkers and was pretty excited because they catered an event at my apartment place and was pleasantly surprised that the food was not mediocre. I thought eating at the restaurant would be an awesome experience. My high hopes were shall we say slightly crushed. I ordered the tofu salad with potatoes and honestly I have had better. I guess I will need to head over to the plaza midwood area to get better vegetarian food. My salad was supposed to come with a biscuit but to my disappointment they forgot to give me one. The waitress did come and asked if everyone one received a "cathead" but by this time my yearning for a tasty biscuit disappeared. I must have had "no biscuit for me" stamped on my forehead that day.   The restaurant atmosphere was pleasant and welcoming. The waitress kept our drinks promptly refilled and our orders were correct. This is not always easy to do when you have a group of six or moreI. I just wish the service matched the taste of the food. I will give it another go but will have to try something else on the menu. I gave this place three stars based on service and the apparent deliciouness of their biscuits (I copped a bite from my co-workers plate).

OqTAmtm-JQxlieU56V0wLA.text: Service was horrible.... Waitress came by to take order and brought us food we waited about 20 minutes before anyone else showed up to table to check on us

58KgI4X62ezf_pdkuH3g3A.text: This review is as respects the coffee.  I was there for breakfast yesterday.  In my opinion the coffee was terrible.  My first taste was bitter and my second and last taste was just bad.  I don't know whether it was the type of coffee they use or how they brew it but, I won't be ordering coffee there again.  Their food is good.

GuQ_advu_Qs59cXmmcmn8Q.text: I have never had grits before and was told that if I had grits I would have to try them from The Flying Biscuit. The wait wasn't that long when we first got there and were seated within about 10 minutes. The colorful ambiance of the restaurant is nice and many people seemed to just be enjoying the company of others around them. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and helped us pick what would go best with our grits.  I must admit, the grits here were simply amazing! It was a great place to have my first grits experience. The service was quick and we were in and out of there relatively fast. We both got breakfast with our grits and it was delicious. A great treat in the South!

91wrXWU98Ldf_hTVGCUpnA.text: Lunch today!  Ordered Brie Cheese appetizer.  It was horrible, very unappetizing to look at and worse try to eat.  Runny stuff all in the bowl, dough was gummy either from the juice or not cooked.  I would have been ashamed to serve this to anyone. The Chicken Club Wrap and potatoes were better though nothing to write home about.  Atmospere a little cramped and cutsy.  Menu items descriptions sounded good but---------- The biscuits were good as was the apple butter served with.

5kTdgMLKehAGOlM-0q0esQ.text: Loved my french toast with raspberry sauce.  The biscuits were not my favorite part of the meal, but I was neither hungry nor over stuffed, and every bite was thoroughly enjoyed,  If you're looking for breakfast and can get here, it's worth it.

NqEh2dvuaB3SmV8vlnywXA.text: Went back last week, and my wife and I got to laughing--it was like the old "Dallas" TV show, when the writers wrote themselves out of a bad year by having Bobby Ewing step out of the shower and Pam realized the past season had all been a bad dream.   When we were at Flying Biscuit last week, everything was as it had been once upon a time: The old servers were back, the food was done correctly, the kitchen was humming. Maybe we caught them in a bad spell a few months ago when everything seemed out of kilter for them, or maybe Bobby Ewing just stepped out of the shower.  Anyway, two stars are back on and the recommendation couldn't be any heartier.

gOHuyNKy7SSmKBQl0E6gaA.text: Well...the Flying Biscuit Cafe is a now a chain. I remember when it was the great little neighborhood spot in Atlanta.  BUT...it is still great.  Here it is in a Charlotte suburban mall area.  Strange, but the food is fantastic, southern style bistro/brunch.  There are tons waiting but they get people in and out and without feeling rushed.  They accommodated two toddlers and some nervous parents...in a cramped space.  It was WELL done. Excellent service.  My shrimp and grits were...yummy...not like incredible...but very good.  I'd go here again if visiting the in-laws.

YuEN6DCHRiQeFmb2sS9dDA.text: I wish Flying Biscuit was good. I like the concept. The execution is just off. It's an example of how healthier fare can be off-putting. Their turkey bacon is like turkey leather. The goat cheese on the fried green tomato blt is dry, so very dry. In fact, everything there is dry. There are ways to eat healthy and/or vegetarian food without sacrificing flavor, but not at the FlyingBiscuit.

DG6BRA7EPxKQVwhI4dDF3Q.text: Everyone was going bonkers for this place so I went and it was okay. I got the veggie burger and can't say I would try it again. However, the grits and biscuits were very, very good. In fact, the grits are near perfection. I think this place works well for people who move to the South and didn't grow up with regular Southern cooking. As someone who was raised on grits, sweet tea & livermush, I find it a little mediocre.  One more thing, the service is great but the wait is long and the sound is deafening in there. it's a small place so be ready for some human contact!

hOqlB6XRyw51CoBM3sE6-g.text: There is not a thing bad I can say about this place with exception that it isn't next to my house. The food couldn't be any better and the fact that there is no pork used there whatsoever had us sold from the get go. From the turkey sausage gravy biscuits to the amazing omelets to their slap yo mamma GRITS, We always eat till they have to get a wheelbarrow to help us to our car. If you haven't this place yet then your missing it. If you go on Saturday morning, make sure you get there before 9am or you will be waiting. Worth every second though.

DIW21l3E3aOWX9UC6jMTRw.text: Visiting NC from South Florida, which is closer to NY on the culinary map than the Deep South, we were craving some down-home style southern food. FBC did not disappoint! Straight from the airport, my bro-in-law brought us to The Flying Biscuit.  Fried green tomatoes to start with an Espresso Stout (Guinness + espresso shot) on the side, delicious!  Then the Cajun Chicken omelet with a dash of the Texas Pete hot sauce--phenomenal! Biscuit was great (of course) but did not fly well ;) Friendly service, fantastic food! Next time we're in Charlotte, we'll be back!

suRQj4xbT0oZfyScGG9hTQ.text: If you are looking for a fantastic breakfast joint, I highly recommend The Flying Biscuit. The grits are amazing as are the biscuits. My wife and I make the drive over here for breakfast regularly, and my family loves the food here.   Think it's all farm to table style, and everything on the menu is tasty. Food was ready in 10-15 minutes, and the service was quick and friendly.   You want to visit this place for breakfast!

guecVUQCc99i4OpXS04DPQ.text: It's never impressive when you don't write your order down. Ordered 2 eggs over med, Country Ham cooked soft with tomato slices.  What did I get you ask?  - 2 eggs over easy  (crusty egg whites pan too hot) - No tomatoes - Potatoes I didn't ask for - Country Ham Cooke's as requested  Food was acceptable   But why not write your order down.... ??????  You're not that good. WRITE IT DOWN!!!!!

YlRlCT18WSF96boJEIHpTg.text: Update: same great food and everyone there I've experienced now is super nice!  Had an issue with an order but they made it right and weren't a hassle, thanks guys.

e69AKXEn8B15tql9cutm-Q.text: Had breakfast with my dining mate on this Sunday morning. My prior rating months ago  was a 5 and today a 3. I ordered the crab cake Benedict. The English muffin was soggy and the crab cake was gritty, soft and floury. When the waitress asked how was everything I told her I was disappointed and she offered to come back with the menu so I could order a different breakfast which I did. So I ordered eggs over and chicken sausage. All good except the biscuit was not as soft  warm and fluffy  as was in our last visit and in my opinion  was day old as the outside texture hard. My dining mate enjoyed his eggs and chicken sausage, potatoes and pancake. The waitress was very accomodating. All places have their off days with menu items. Maybe today was just that.
