LCCACYZhRjiQD-CzUdhP1A.text: Absolutely amazing! It's not often I leave a positive review, but they deserve it. The food was great. It went beyond what I was expecting and was exactly what I wanted. I'm very picky with how my eggs are cooked and they came out perfectly. The portion was worth the price, I actually couldn't finish it. Amanda M. was a great server. She was very friendly, helpful and accommodating and she offered up suggestions. The manager, Russel came out and checked on us and introduced himself as well. Overall I had a great experience. The food was delicious and the staff was very welcoming.

vQbn11KGj_a3-djBcKjFLg.text: Tried Flying Biscuit for the first time today with my coworkers for payday lunch. I enjoyed my "egg-ceptional breakfast" w/ the delicious creamy grits. I would definitely come back and try some other options. Coworkers enjoyed their food as well. The biscuit was good, not great. Not salty enough. Also, the apple butter could use improvement. It was too liquid.. I would prefer Cracker Barrel's or store bought. Service was great! Will go back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Egg-ceptional Breakfast&#34; &amp; biscuit

Rk8NMAGn064EDv36X0svng.text: This was our second visit here and we were slightly disappointed. I think it was an off day since we overheard they lost a few workers. Otherwise, the food was pretty good. I did enjoy the Cajun scramble a lot! But the pancake was cold and tough. We also didn't enjoy the crepe... my husband had a basic egg and sausage meal and said it was just okay. The biscuits were excellent as always as well as the grits. We will be back for another try and hope that we fall in love again.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

e3XC9JWxx0MKcl0hkH5Ibw.text: Breakfast is good and reliable, nice vibe inside and usually pretty quick service. Decided to get the Biscuit Pot Pie, the menu photo showed browned biscuits on top, then it arrived these white doughy biscuits with mounds of SUGAR on top. Why on EARTH would you put sugar on a chicken pot pie?! Who does that? No one. No one does that. Not at all like the photo, and tasted very strange in a bad way, so if I come back it'll be only breakfast stuff.

yMZaK53DsCkksFsDbPOHfw.text: Today they screwed up my order but they were so nice they had great customer service and I really appreciate them redoing my order thank you so much for the greens also!!! Very nice ladies with sweet personalities! thanks again!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

0Vov4_4-Br7AoApjJ9EAMQ.text: What I learned today is not all Flying Biscuit places are created equal. This one was far away but worth the 30min drive. The shrimp and grits were pretty good and the staff was super friendly and helpful. I would've missed this location if it wasn't for the gift certificate that I bought through local flavor.   The grits were super creamy and the shrimp were really good but I am not a tomatoes fan so I picked those out which made the dish awesome. I will be back yo this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

zbv1bId-PfqbOeOBjU1Pbg.text: Flying biscuit never disappoint me. We've been many times before. Specially weekends for breakfast. Always busy. The only negative thing that I need to say is that when you must wait for at least 20-45 minutes, to have a space (anywhere, even bar), the girls that are usually outside calling people, make a mess.  Today we said: party of two. Even counter/bar. Some people that might be after you, probably will be sit down before. After 15-20' she called us, and of course, there was enough space in the bar, however we were sat in a small table inside, near the restrooms. That's why my 4 *.  Austin, our waiter, was very knowledgeable about  the menu. He made some suggestion, that save us some bucks. Came to check our table many times.  I ordered a latte. Actually was super small for the price, so never again. But our breakfast was absolutely amazing.   We left happy and with leftovers. And that's all I asked.   Totally recommend The Flying!  Great food, excellent customer service.   Thank you Austin!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Try the house-made sauce! Everything on point!
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small cup of latte. $4,49...

sgNXaffdKG2My1ClAkahFw.text: First off, the service was horrible.  It could have been due to a heavier than normal day after a holiday however, the manager should have planned ahead.  This still doesn't excuse the fact that our waiter was inattentive (we had to get up to ask for coffee refills and we weren't the only ones) and he got my husbands order wrong.  My food was tasty but it wasn't hot and most likely was sitting under a heat lamp to be picked up.  Definitely wont be back, our first impression was not a good one.

GVvKXHvzX1U0hz9Rtybj4w.text: Short story: Great food, great prices, friendly waitress/waiters.   Long story: First impressions walking in- very artsy and colorful decor. Super cute little cafe. I took a couple pics of the ceiling tiles that had each little square painted differently. The bar had twinkle lights strung across.   The waitress was very nice and even the bus boy came by to refill our coffees. Good service. Prices are pretty standard for a nice breakfast place. Good size portions. The coffee was good as well, and I'm picky with my coffee. I like it strong so if you serve me weak coffee it's not worth drinking. This coffee was pretty good.   I didn't feel like ordering a whole meal so I ordered a side of bacon and a side of grits. The bacon was perfectly crispy without being burnt and had good flavor. The grits - this is why we came here to begin with. Our family we were staying with raved about their grits so we had to try them before heading back home. I'm not typically a grits fan but these were so creamy! I feel like they may have cream cheese blended in or something! I would eat these all the time if I lived here.   My husband ordered an omelet. That's his go to and it was pretty standard as most are but good sized. I tried a piece of his biscuit just because I felt obligated given the name of the cafe. I didn't care for it but to be fair I'm not a biscuit lover to begin with. Everyone else liked them. Would come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

SIRsfEP7eJrRd8ye5xm2ig.text: The best brunch spot Hands Down! I love the diversity  and culture and LOVE the fact that  they sell other meats for breakfast  besides Pork.

fzfzi2aUlFIMQzXOEHPZ3A.text: Ate here once and the food was just alright.  Nothing special.  I'd say Toast is the better choice --just a personal opinion.  The staff are very polite and service was fantastic.    Nice courtyard area to side of store, and plenty of parking.

18xW1VCGwv-mIJ98uSUkKw.text: We have been going to the flying biscuit since 2009 as students in the Raleigh area. It was always out perfect brunch spot for fantastic biscuits, fluffy pancakes, and creative healthy options. This flying biscuit is just the same, very colorful, amazing waitstaff (Russell was our new best friend by the tine we left!) and last but not least, the food is spectacular! Can't wait to go again during our next NC trip! Highly recommend!

ixRt1G3BqF13trLZvLvTHQ.text: Came here for a weekend brunch and made it before the crowd. It's a small place, but luckily, we hardly had to wait. I had the Smoked Salmon Scramble (3 eggs scrambled with smoked salmon and dill cream cheese, served with grits and a biscuit, $10.49). Boyfriend had the Breakfast Bowl (2 oven-fried green tomatoes, turkey bacon, and 2 over-medium eggs, served atop a bowl of grits and topped with salsa, $10.99). I see what the rave is all about with the grits; it's so creamy and delicious! Grits has grown on me, and even though there were no shrimp in my grits, I still fell in love with it! My scramble was good, not great. The eggs were nice and fluffy, but I wish my biscuit was soft and warm instead of dry and crumbly. After having a couple spoonfuls of my boyfriend's meal, I'd say his meal was the winner. Service was good. Food arrived very quickly. There are tons of other options on the menu, and I'm looking forward to trying out the others.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

3Ln12GkJ8uiPVIxIp4d6rg.text: I've dined in and carried out, the Flying Biscuit Cafe never disappoints. I am absolutely in love with the biscuits and gravy, the grits--delicious, and the apple butter, to die for  definitely a great breakfast spot, family friendly with outdoor seating as well. Fast and friendly wait staff as well

vPRMq0tvDGhaBQeG1JquNw.text: Went here on a busy Sunday morning and got seated after a 20 minute wait. The decor is funky and fun and despite being packed, the noise level was acceptable for conversation.  Service deserves five stars as our server, Lindsey was outstanding! Friendly, attentive, helpful and made the best mimosas we've had (the servers make the drinks). She checked on us several times during the meal and my coffee cup never got less then half empty.  The food did not quite live up to expectations but was not bad. I ordered the High Flyer. My eggs were cooked hard instead of over medium and we all did not care for their slightly spicey chicken sausage, but that's a personal preference. Their creamy, dreamy grits were delicious and the name sums them up perfectly! My meal also came with a thick oatmeal pancake with peach compote which was good, but dense and not fluffy. Of course, our meal came with two huge biscuits. The all thought the biscuits were a bit heavy and dense. Each table has bottles of cranberry applesauce which we poured over the biscuits. The applesauce is very good with just the right mix of cranberry to add flavor without being overpowering or too tart.

1ld_am-kDH9S4aUKQtRfIg.text: Okay.. I am going to keep this simple. ... I didn't think you could ruin breakfast food, but yesterday I found out you can.  I've never written a review on a restaurant until now and I'm hoping the owners read this.  The service was great... fast and our waiter. Was efficient.  Then came a biscuit that had such a hard crust, not even the gravy would make it soft ... I asked for crispy bacon and I got something that was the consistency of beef jerky... the gravy was sweet and was so thick it looked like mashed potatoes.... and my boyfriend had chicken sausage as hard as hockey pucks...and what happened to the grits.  ...Thin and watery.   But the coffee was good

jqjMDJDBFkxEaigeRkBJqA.text: Visited this place during a wedding with my Wife. This place was nice and cozy. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The total experience was great, however the lack of PORK meat choices got them 4 instead of 5 stars. I must be honest and say the turkey bacon in my Southern Scramble was more than enough to satisfy my picky palette. I highly recommend the scramble!  The overall menu is large and breakfast is sold All Day. So yes, you can roll out of bed anytime and have Flying Biscuits. The biscuits are not really biscuits, they look more like rolls with a biscuit interior; this could be a little unusual for some. I had mine with apple cranberry butter and it was delish. I recommend you try them at least once.

OG6lJ5lBo4boPb1va261gw.text: If you are searching for "Southern" style food this is not the place for you.  The grits are awful. The grits are a HEAVY creamy-cheesy-dairy pudding concoction that lacks texture, almost a purred baby food consistency. My biscuit was incredibly dry, bland, and hard.  Every time I took a bite, it just crumbled in my plate.  I also tried the "Fried Green Tomatoes" and was very disappointed. Completely lack luster, oily and undercooked.      The only bright spot about this place is the staff.

7i3UmRNvHwsvRku3Tcy8hA.text: OMG!! By far the best breakfast spots in the WORLD. LoL Great food...I had the Southern Scramble and my husband had the Shrimp Scramble. Great fast service. I recommend going.

LvzJEJI0UFbDxw3jbihwNA.text: The grits were to die for!! Loved the sausage gravy, and the biscuits were fantastic. Good service. Fun atmosphere! We will definitely go back!

DSMz1wF-L5OvfAn9laPDAA.text: Came here for a Sunday breakfast.   The food was fine. I had the french toast with raspberry and vanilla sauce. The sauces were yummy, the french toast itself not very impressive, and altogether it was a little on the sweet side but good. ($7)   My husband had the eggs-travaganza. He loved the grits, but they only offer turkey bacon and what I think is chicken sausage. It's nice to have that option but it would be better if traditional options were offered too, which my husband would have preferred. Eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuit and half order of French toast was around $9.50 or so. I am mentioning the prices since their website doesn't show them, which is a bad restaurant habit that I hate.  Our server was very friendly, but bringing out the food was rather disorganized and we got the wrong thing first. They fixed that quickly though.  Altogether the place was fine but not really memorable and had the distinct feel of a chain. It is located in the Stonecrest mall near the Nothing but NOodles place (we had trouble locating the Flying Biscuit for a while).

tqw1tyKojoiqRMHP6JiW3Q.text: Best biscuits ever!   Went for brunch today and got the tofu scramble with potatoes.  Really tasty.  My husband got the fried tomato blt. Also yummy.   Not expensive and only fifteen minute wait which was nice.  Our waitress was pleasant.

R68HwW3_I4seXS1ojcFOFw.text: Food is not good.  Nothing like the Atlanta original.  The biscuits are no longer the best around.  The eggs I ordered were not hot and the pancake was burnt on the side they turned down on the plate.   Sent the pancake back.  Would not go back

4V_uh0ynNXknNsaCQUeikg.text: This is our favorite location because of the great server Amanda!  She always has a smile and a friendly outgoing personality.  We love the food but always look to see if Amanda is working before we sit.  You don't always find servers who are happy at where they work, but she always makes you feel welcome!

kwnHBm9egBHrSIoVhJOckw.text: We had outstanding service provided by Amanda. The quality of the food was excellent. We were served quickly and the restaurant was spotless

kfIAvfhI2OhNqooF_ORH7w.text: My niece, son an I visited this place on Easter Sunday, we were very happily surprised to find no waiting and a very clean outdoor seating area. We both ordered pancakes, mine were blueberry. So yummy and refreshing that they used real blueberries. I ordered mango nectar for my infant son who drank every last sip. Only concern was our server she seemed very distracted and every sentence sounded like she was asking a question (secretly we enjoyed the laugh).

W3C2a6VUx18iexL14uP7uQ.text: Flying biscuit is the best breakfast in Charlotte hands down. The food, service and atmosphere are all excellent. All of the servers are awesome but I always return to see Susan P and never have I been disappointed. The service is always fast and efficient when you sit with Susan. I highly suggest eating at flying biscuit and requesting her if you are looking for great breakfast and vibrant hospitality. Also do yourself a favor and get the grits. You won't be disappointed

53OOJ_uFxxnmJM0h64csoA.text: Susan P. at Stonecrest location waited on me and she was the BEST server I have ever had! Very attentive and knew what I needed before I even had to ask! Food was great!

weW7X0wxsHX0KS4L96JeqA.text: Yum! What a satisfying breakfast and friendly atmosphere! I had the Biscuit, eggs, and gravy and smothered it all in their signature cranberry apple butter and it was perfect. Fast service! I wish I lived closer so I could come every morning. Biscuits really are perfect and the grits truly are dreamy. 5 stars!! Sit at the bar to have a great time with Juan!

_bBW4-j1m0F0tJvwPur8PQ.text: It surprises me that the Flying Biscuit has a such a middling average rating.  It's always been one of my favorite chain restaurants, and it doesn't even feel like a chain unless you know that multiples exist.  Service is friendly and attentive... even after the last time we went, when I accidentally elbowed our waitress in the stomach.  No crying or cursing; she very graciously accepted my apology and continued on.  I felt horrible and left her an extra-big tip, by the way.  The food isn't cheap, but it's not outrageously expensive, either.  You can get a breakfast with an egg dish, grits, and a biscuit for about $8.  Are people really complaining that's too expensive?  I must be eating in the wrong places, because that seems pretty dang reasonable to me.  For breakfast, I usually get either the Meggixcan Wrap, which has just the right amount of early-morning heat, or the Piedmont Omelet, which actually makes turkey bacon sound good.  Speaking of turkey, if you're going for dinner, you *must* try the turkey meatloaf.  Probably the best I've had: moist and topped with salsa... delicious.  The sides are good too.  The biscuits are lighter than the usual southern fare, but I think they're good, and the grits are indeed a creamy dream.    The only downside to this location is that it's small.  This leads to short waits during peak hours and to elbowing waitresses in the stomach.   I am sorry I elbowed you in the stomach, Flying Biscuit Waitress.

9hheahkxUDMBxwl1xDfydQ.text: I really liked it, had the sausage and gravy biscuits dish with a iced hazelnut iced latte.  Both were delicious, got the grits as my side but next time will get the mac and cheese which really hit the spot as I stole a bite from my hubby.  There can be a wait on Saturdays and Sundays. We waited for 10 mins for a table for 4 and a baby at 11:30am which isn't bad at all. All the inside tables were full and half the outside but we requested to be inside.  Service was quick and pleasant. Everyone enjoyed their food including the lunch items.  We will be back to try more things.

9mOAMdotGyCNYeN2xFm3Xw.text: Yes, it's a chain. You wouldn't know it, though, except that the ceiling tiles are screen printed instead of hand painted with winged biscuits and other such culinary literalisms. For some reason, that element makes the Charlotte locations smell of franchise. Otherwise, the interiors do a decent job pushing the pretense that the restaurant is in a converted bungalow near those of the original Biscuit in Atlanta's Candler Park, or that it is a hometown diner that has been there for years instead of doing business in Charlotte's newer and oldest shopping centers.  Lines form on weekend mornings with people salivating over the breakfast served all day on Fiestaware, especially the biscuits sprinkled with sugar and served with homemade cranberry apple butter. And those grits. Those creamy, dreamy grits that made this lifelong grits detester see the light at the end of the hominyless tunnel. Grits can and should be made with heavy cream. If they aren't, they aren't worth eating.  Lunch and dinner options are as tasty as those from the breakfast all day menu; many are altered with eggs or the lack thereof to make them appropriate for the time of day. Case in point: Egg-Ceptional Eggs and Love Cakes, both of which are in the Top Five Favorites dishes of this writer. Daily specials are posted on the boards outside, and are usually worth a try. Menu substitutions are easy, and so is the staff, which in general is pleasantly attentive.  Though it is not a Charlotte original, we'll claim it as our own, if only for those devilishly alluring grits.

CGRSXc4uos8GyQzTwOzDiQ.text: Service was very slow and the place was dirty. The floor looked like it had not been swept in a week and the tables had syrup and biscuit crumbs on them.  Not to mention when I stood up my husband had to point out I had biscuit crumbs all over my backside from sitting down and I did not even eat a biscuit.

ZAn9eKKyAtTjjjj29UYR7Q.text: The food was good and came out fast which somewhat made up for the lack of speed and urgency from the rest of the staff. A decent experience overall.

9wUJ7HitT9Hft0-rD6ueaw.text: This place has amazing breakfast and the Southern Style Benedict with Pimento Cheese is incredible!  Time to start coming back for Breakfast for Dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern Style Benedict!

hX5ydR77oa4SIbmnqhWFaA.text: While the food was really great, the service was deplorable! After being seated for at least 10 minutes we finally flagged someone down to take our drink order.  It wasnt for lack of wait staff because the two tables next to ours seemed to get plenty of attention. In fact, one of those tables was seated after us and they received their food before we even got our drinks! This poor service continued throughout, no one checking for drink refills or to see if we needed anything else.  Meanwhile that table that got served before us (same number of people at the table) finished and was out the door about 15 minutes before us.  The only negative on the food was that I got a scramble with a side of roasted potatoes not knowing that the scramble included hashbrowns. The roasted potatoes were outstanding whereas the hashbrowns were old, fried, and very greasy. What a shame! Ask to sub roasted potatoes for hashbrowns. You wont be disappointed.

s2KcZR0RsvxwhiPO4sOnAA.text: NOMnomNOMnomNOM.  This place is really popular and for good reason, so expect to wait for a table upon arrival.  It's really one of the few hipster places to get good quality breakfast food after sleeping in.  You'll have a hard time choosing what to eat cause everything sounds so good. To no surprise, it tastes even better than it sounds because you're very very hungry :)

r-Qfn1fVoRPMCMPCBs9X4Q.text: The food was good...not great. The service was terrible. Took 30 minutes to get condiments and 20 minutes and multiple asks for the check.  Upon further review...just noticed the server charged us for drinks that should have been included in kids meal. 6.58 for two kids milk. Ugh...

Npyr2qBunBQKTirDsEHoiw.text: DONT let them place you on hold. Assuming you want to talk to someone within the next ten minutes or so...

ObOsYAP2F73F1HIn2ABSUQ.text: For the most part, we enjoy breakfast here. There is one waiter that is incredibly friendly and efficient. He's a Hispanic man that works there just a couple days a week. Otherwise the wait staff is hit or miss and the food can be REALLY good sometimes and just okay other times when the waitresses warn that the regular cook is not there. You can never go wrong with their grits though.

iXr4n3N7JbKUFWMErMURsw.text: Awesome presentation for 2 hungry northerners. Creamy dreamy Grits, oatmeal pancake, tart turkey sausage and a mile high biscuit to two.

62ehufAcAwAT_EwBISJn9g.text: The food is amazing but the service is horrible. They have attitudes which makes you afraid to ask for anything else. I am a waitress and i would never treat someone like they treat me constantly when i go there. I'd rate it a 4 on the food but because of the attitudes and nastiness  of the waiters and waitresses i give it a 1 star. Having to deal with this type of service is horrible and is a terrible atmosphere to walk into when im trying to grab breakfast with family. Its a shame since this place is great but i would not recommended it unless you're okay with dealing with snobby service and continuously begging to get a refill on water.

C7sxHmaPcSiyK21PTWbBig.text: I ordered the Flying Biscuit Breakfast which includes two eggs, grits, chicken sausage, and a giant biscuit. The wait was 20-30 minutes, and the service was friendly. My favorite was the grits and eggs. The chicken sausage was decent, but I prefer hog. The biscuit itself was a bit doughy for my taste, but the apple butter was quite good. I would definitely return to try something else.

vUKToSYpjszPkGpaUOVpxQ.text: The food is okay but service is terrible. I have been here twice. Each time it took forever to get service.  The first time we were getting ready to order again when we got  handed our check. Wow!  Not once did the server swing by to ask if I needed anything.    Second visit - I was served coffee and had to wait 20 minutes to get cream and sugar by which time my coffee was cold. It wasn't even crowded!  The food was average at best.  Walked in to pay my check as I got tired of waiting.  Not too clean either. Would not visit again.

yyCY-8SWxjripm97LFfBNg.text: We went here for breakfast and it was so beyond delicious!!! We had the Benedict and biscuits & gravy. Our server was Amanda M. and it was excellent service!!! So because of Amanda and the food we will definitely be returning!!

GGHif5FTb6Ee3G_yp2QQ-w.text: I went for the first time this past week and I was really impressed! Prior to going, I looked up the menu and expected the food to be decent since the pricing is relatively low. And I was worried when we walked in and the restaurant was pretty slow for 730pm. Our waitress, Amanda, assured us with a wink that we had perfect timing and beat the rush. She went over some of the popular menu items and extended a recently expired discount on our ciders, off to a good start!   My bf and I ordered the 3b Chicken sandwich and the bbq salmon. Our food came out within 10 minutes and looked awesome. The salmon was nicely seasoned and the coke bbq sauce was very tasty. But the shining star on my plate was the green beans! They had this smoky garlic flavor to them that had me hooked. I would go back just to get a plate of them. My bf loved his chicken sandwich, especially since they use turkey bacon. We always take a portion home for lunch the next day, and even reheated the food held it's flavor.  Overall, the service was quick and pleasant! And the food was delicious and at a price point that we'll be returning very soon! From what I read in previous reviews, if the service was lacking for you, then this place definitely deserves a second chance.

lLyV8CCt5ugW0yaRxsaAfw.text: Stopped here for breakfast on the way to the airport. The staff was very kind and attentive, food was very yummy and came quickly.

UKvNORDUmLs4GK1XC5_geg.text: We visit The Flying Biscuit almost every week.  Susan P. Is a fantastic server and has our preferences memorized, which is amazing since several members of our family are vegetarian/ vegan and what we order isn't straight from the menu.  We highly recommend The Flying Biscuit, Stonecrest!

mYECEUh4CYzpzDa4a5VP6Q.text: Second time here since we moved from San Francisco in February.  I never really like any of biscuits I had in the bay area, but here, Oh my god! It's the best biscuit I ever had. I was so amazed by the favor and the texture. It's buttery and delicious. This time,  I had the southern omelette and I love the greens mix in with turkey and cheese, it's perfect balance for breakfast.

rh7TQCsi0PFRRSXVad3SIg.text: I think we found our go-to breakfast place.    Stopped in here on a Saturday morning for breakfast and can't wait to go back!  I got the goat cheese and pesto omlette with a side of potatoes and a biscuit, and the boy got a pancake with a side of grits.   My omlette was so delicious!  I usually offer the Boy a bite but it was so good I didn't want to share.  It had roasted tomato sauce on it and it was filled with Goat cheese.  Ah-Maze-ing. The potatoes were very good and exactly what I was expecting, the biscuit came with sugar sprinkled on top which was so delicious and so NOT what I was expecting.    The Boy's pancake was the best pancake I've ever tasted in my 30 years on this Earth.  Hands down.  I would come back for the pancakes alone. His creamy grits were very good and a kind we hadn't tried before.    The atmosphere was very noisy and it was VERY small, the tables were packed in so tight it was tough to get in and out of your seat.  But because of the food quality it was worth it.

ApIqDEED4WoYXQ0Aluhvtw.text: Overall, This place was a little better than average.   The place was cute. The staff was pleasant. And it had this original feel to the place. Not quite like any restaurant I went to before.     I got biscuits and gravy with eggs and their potatoes. Overall. The biscuits and gravy were good. The potatoes were heavily seasoned... But I still liked them.   The food that everyone else ordered was only okay. If you eat the biscuits on their own, they were SUPER dry and crumbly. (The apple butter made this a little more bearable). The grits were okay. Not the best texture.   I had to knock off another star because there were flies EVERYWHERE. They kept landing by us.  On my straw. By the food. Kinda gross.   We were on vacation, so it is not a restaurant I would go back to. But it was cute.

7xdCzeVuPri7FCDDTUbInw.text: I'm truly a HUGE fan of the Flying Biscuit - but sad to say, this location doesn't hold a candle to the Park Rd locale - just seems inconsistent and the service was adequate at best. Park Rd has better energy and the staff just seem so much more personable - Sorry Rea Rd, I will make the drive to Park Rd from now on - (even if you're closer to home)!

5HmrQT8axyUo1z0XqDQFdw.text: Went to Biscuit for the first time today.  The atmosphere is good for kids and pleasant.  The tables are pretty close together and the space is not very large...so come early if you do not want to wait for breakfast. I had the Southern Scramble which was very good.  The kids organic oatmeal pancake was also excellent.  The turkey bacon not so good, so go to the real meat if you order a side. Will come back again since we didn't have any of the issues outlined in some of the posts.

PRipLsRN0y7G4tWftddxag.text: A twist on traditional breakfast foods.  The entire menu is avaialable all day everyday.  For those of you that dont enjoy brekafats, mush like myself, there are plenty of non breakfast items.  With that being said I actually enjoyed the breakfast items more than the lunch items.  The biscuits were different than what you traditionally expect.  The apple butter was delish!  The sausage gravy was to die for but it is much different from traditional sausage gravy.  The gravy tastes more like stuffing due to its punch of flavor (i could taste a lot of rosemary).  Ive only ate grits a few times as I am not from the south but these grits were unbelievable!  Go for the grits no matter what!  The chicken sandwich I ordered was a chicken sandwich.  The steak breakfast is well worth the money as you actually get a thick steak cooked perfectly opposite of the flat freezer steak you get at most breakfast restaurants!  Overall this is a must go with prices that are reasonable but not cheap.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

34IoDmv1-nBxUcdxtOXjzg.text: Over the course of several visits, I've found both the food and the service to be hit or miss.  The biscuits are not the best in the world, but the apple-butter concoction is yummo!   However, I give this place four stars because they have some very solid breakfast offerings.  Plus, this is just about  the only  place close by that truly offers breakfast all day, which is a good thing if you love b-fast as much as me & David do!  Another thing that I like about FBC is that you can get Chicken sausage or turkey bacon instead of pork without paying an up-charge (like you have to do at Skillets).    Also, if  you really don't want grits, you can ask for potatoes instead.   (However, their grits are quite good - not runny & tasteless like so many places!)  I think it sounds weird, but I really like the "Pasta, Sausage, and Eggs" which is made of eggs scrambled with chicken sausage, penne pasta, spinach, mushrooms, and cheddar cheese.  It rocks!

TeV6ifewjkg915kwtiUafw.text: Flying Biscuit.  What a delightful name.  A projectile bakery good.  I first went to a Flying Biscuit in Atlanta, GA.  It was a fantastic, unique brunch experience.  So we went back the next day, too.  That's why I was excited that Charlotte was getting one a couple of years later.    We arrived at the Flying Biscuit in Stonecrest on a Sunday before the church crowd let out.  Unfortunately, it wasn't early enough.  We had about a 30 minute wait.  After our name was finally called, we discovered why.  The restaurant didn't have a lot of seating and we were squooshed by a table right near the front door.    The menu items were just as good as in Atlanta; they tend to be more organic and/or vegetarian in their food offerings.  However, this Flying Biscuit didn't have the same ambiance as the first one in Atlanta that I experienced, and I guess that really makes the difference.  In Atlanta, the restaurant was filled with an eclectic group of people.  In Charlotte, it was filled with soccer moms and dads who arrived via minivan.  I do want to go back to give the Charlotte location another try, but maybe I'll try lunch or dinner instead and treasure my brunch in Atlanta.   p.s. Their biscuits ARE delicious no matter where you go, though!  :)

fw9TAy97NEaIrshZQNV72A.text: This is my favorite place for breakfast or brunch.  The Southern Benedict is ridiculously good. The service is surprisingly fast and the food is very consistent. This is a well run restaurant that will be a regular in the eating rotation.

hoXz2_pzfd5NUSERu6a24g.text: I love Flying Biscuit's food. However, I tried to schedule a going-away wedding brunch here and the staff was SO INCREDIBLY unhelpful. Lq3oMC5fn8z39B5vB3zErA.text: Food was kinda gross. Biscuits were hard. No condiments on the table. Although my waiter was nice, he didn't refill my drink or question why I didn't eat the food.

vAqDK6as2BY8lgVWsch9eg.text: Traveled to NC to visit a friend and she took me to this place. She explained that the biscuits and grits (which I had never had) were amazing. She was 100 percent right! The place is very quaint and unique, which I loved. They seemed to be very busy, which was a great sign for the business. We waited for around 20 minutes and it was definitely worth the short wait time. The apple butter that goes on the biscuits could be addictive, if I lived closer. I would recommend this place to anyone in the area or visiting.

idr5mUzso7qdkVT8uoBfXw.text: I've been here for both breakfast and dinner. I prefer their dinner entrees - I think most any place can make breakfast food but their main courses are a real treat. The shrimp and grits and biscuit pot pie are my favorite winter time comfort foods. Huge portions = leftovers for lunch the next day! And don't skip putting apple butter on your biscuit - it's like a little complimentary dessert! Small interior isn't conducive to larger parties (plan to pull over a chair for more than 6 people). Friendly staff, unstuffy atmosphere, quick service.

fEPzgwCuUz8emrgd1NiQcQ.text: What can you say about Flying Biscuit cafes? They are all yummy. The prices are always a little steep for some basic eggs but the dense biscuits make up for it. If you like thick thick heavy biscuits with sprinkled sugar on top, you will adore these biscuits. If you are into the fluffy flaky biscuits, this is NOT for you. Actually the same goes for their oatmeal pancake. Totally great for you if you want to fill up before a long drive or will not eat again for 5+hours. But if your tummy reacts to coffee the way some do, make sure a stall is close by. Haha They are fiberlicious. The grits are what i prefer because they are made with cheese and cream. Again...stall close by. (smile). Now as far as lunch here, I cannot speak on it as I prefer breakfast food morning, afternoon and evening. The tables at this location are jammed together so that is why 4 stars. Weird because they stufd you like an ihop crepe but then expect you to walk sideways to your seat. (smile) The waitstaff has been cool here too. Kind of a grunge feel too. Think of your coolest pizza grunge spot with the guy with the giant holes pierced through his lobes complete with skully...now apply this look to breakfast in Ballantyne.

8CD5TD8-xl7cIqP3DpZhwg.text: Solid brunch with great service.  Had brunch during the weekday here and enjoyed the southern eggs Benny.  Very tasty with extremely flaky and delicious biscuits.  Pimento cheese and delicious hollandaise adorned the top were excellent.  The oatmeal pancake was tasty but somewhat dense but I suppose that is to be expected.  Overall for the price and service it would definitely be a place I return and bring others!

D1sAiz2W_KiGJ6_WBEySJg.text: Overall this place is fine. Not somewhere I would bring out of town guests to. I felt the biscuits were slightly underdone and didn't have that golden biscuit look, but was stark white. Tried the apple butter that is on the table, while good didn't have that butter taste more like apple pie filling. Not a bad thing just not what I expected.  Tried the grilled mac and cheese and was not that impressed. I had the chicken pot pie, which was more like a soup then a pot pie. I make better at home. My husband had the black bean and cornmeal cakes, once again not impressed.    Service was acceptable,  food came out quick. Waitress was aware and attentive,  which one can appreciate.

pLgARsfzn6UB0V7iFXX_sA.text: We pulled up and put our names in for a table during sunday breakfast. We were told it would be 10 minutes so we. Went out and parked the car. We came back in and were the only people standing at the hostess stand. There were multiple empty tables but it was still busy. The Hostess then looks at me and tells me that we have to wait outside because of "fire code" . Its raining outside. My head almost exploded. Ive never had anyone tell me I had to stand out in the rain for a table especially when we were the only people standing there. I dont even know what was going through these retards minds. If thats how you treat your customers Im not sure how they stay in business.

wZvVQ0fYRYOoBpwrytty8w.text: Great food but the wait is a bit much and when I got my food the eggs that said they were poached were hard boiled. But other than that the eggs Benedetto was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Biscuit Cafe- Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

KzcwdyECaZzPA65vsL4Ftw.text: Nothing but the biscuits are original. And they are fair at best. Everything in this restaurant is packaged. All they do here is open packaging from bulk packing they ordered from the huge warehouse for restaurants. Even the honey for the biscuit came in the small package tube. Seriously wouldn't you think they would have fresh homegrown honey for their "famous" biscuits". Coffee was terrible go across the parking lot and get FRESH GROUND from SB. I had to cut the vegetables in my omelet to make them bit size, so I could eat it. The staff was grumpy and our server at the bar was very unpleasant. Come on it is morning... who wants to be greeted that way first thing of the day

GvhA9QpZykW6gWph82pLcA.text: We've been here a few times and it's just awesome. The biscuits and gravy are amazing and the grits were great. They are always packed on the weekends to prepare for a wait. Oh and get extra chicken sausage, trust me you won't regret it.  Just awesome!

TZtKWsL9iUzhM1vSsZx9dA.text: The organic oatmeal pancakes with peach compote were absolutely AMAZING! They were so soft, fluffy, and flavorful! Also, my waitress, Amanda M., was so kind, energetic, personable, and happy to serve me! I cannot wait to return to the Flying Biscuit Cafe!

G4FSzXnJJCsaNZn14io4Fg.text: I've been to flying biscuit several times in 3years, and Amanda has always given my friends and I such excellent service! Always upbeat and super friendly!
